MALAYSIA SHORTS

News aggregated and shorten to save your precious time!

  • LOCAL ENFORCEMENT POSSIBLY BRIBED BY INTERNATIONAL SCAM SYNDICATE, SAYS MACC CHIEF

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/23/local-enforcement-possibly-bribed-by-international-scam-syndicate-says-macc-chief

    02/23/2023, 12:06

    64.71% Shortened!

    Thursday, 23 Feb 2023

    "We do not rule out the possibility that certain local enforcement personnel were offering the syndicate protection,” said Azam

    When asked why the police were not involved in the joint operation, Azam said they made the decision as the case involved offences committed under the MACC Act and Immigration Act

    A joint operation by the MACC – together with the Immigration Department, Inland Revenue Board and Cyber Security Malaysia – led to the arrest of 81 suspects including British and Philippine nationals

    Azam said the main mastermind of the syndicate has been identified as a man from the United Kingdom in his late 40's

    "Our investigations revealed the syndicate targetted victims from either Australia or the United Kingdom

    ['scam', 'syndicate', 'macc', 'say', 'azam']

    Thursday, 23 Feb 2023

  • CASH AID FOR B40 WILL BE ANNOUNCED WHEN BUDGET 2023 UNVEILED, SAYS ANWAR

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/23/cash-aid-for-b40-will-be-announced-when-budget-2023-unveiled-says-anwar

    02/23/2023, 11:07

    60.0% Shortened!

    In a Parliamentary written reply, the Prime Minister said the government is committed to ensure that direct cash assistance will continue to be channeled to the target groups to cope with the rising cost of living

    The government is concerned about the welfare of every strata of society, especially the B40 group," said Anwar

    Zahari had asked if these households will receive some cash every month as part of an effort to eradicate poverty In response, Anwar said the government is concerned about the welfare of all Malaysians, especially B40 income-earners

    "In 2022, the government allocated a total of RM8bil for the implementation of direct cash assistance to 8.7 million recipients in a bid to address the cost of living faced by the people after the Covid-19 pandemic," said the Prime Minister

    "In addition, apart from Rahmah Cash Contribution, the Social Welfare Department (JKM) also provides a child assistance scheme of up to RM1,000 per month to poor families,” said Anwar

    "The scheme includes those who earn below the poverty line income, which is RM1,169 per month," he added Anwar is due to table the revised Budget 2023 on Friday in his capacity as Finance Minister after the previous administration under Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob tabled the Budget on Oct 7 last year, involving an allocation of RM372.3bil

    ['cash', 'budget', 'say', 'anwar', 'government']

    In a Parliamentary written reply, the Prime Minister said the government is committed to ensure that direct cash assistance will continue to be channeled to the target groups to cope with the rising cost of living

    The government is concerned about the welfare of every strata of society, especially the B40 group," said Anwar

    Zahari had asked if these households will receive some cash every month as part of an effort to eradicate poverty In response, Anwar said the government is concerned about the welfare of all Malaysians, especially B40 income-earners

    "In 2022, the government allocated a total of RM8bil for the implementation of direct cash assistance to 8.7 million recipients in a bid to address the cost of living faced by the people after the Covid-19 pandemic," said the Prime Minister

    "In addition, apart from Rahmah Cash Contribution, the Social Welfare Department (JKM) also provides a child assistance scheme of up to RM1,000 per month to poor families,” said Anwar

    "The scheme includes those who earn below the poverty line income, which is RM1,169 per month," he added Anwar is due to table the revised Budget 2023 on Friday in his capacity as Finance Minister after the previous administration under Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob tabled the Budget on Oct 7 last year, involving an allocation of RM372.3bil

    ['cash', 'budget', 'say', 'anwar', 'government']



  • CHICKEN, EGG PRICE FLOAT: WITH EIGHT FIRMS DOMINATING, HOW WILL GOVT KEEP IT AFFORDABLE FOR B60? CHARLES SANTIAGO ASKS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/23/chicken-egg-price-float-with-eight-firms-dominating-how-will-govt-keep-it-affordable-for-b60-charles-santiago-asks/56318

    02/23/2023, 11:07

    45.45% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 23 — Former Klang MP Charles Santiago today questioned how chicken and eggs can remain affordable for the B60 or those in the bottom 60 per cent income tier in Malaysia if the government removes the maximum selling price after June, given that just a few companies dominate production of these food items

    He called for transparency in the government’s removal of price controls or plan to float the prices of chicken and eggs

    “Given that eight firms control 65 per cent of production, how will the Ministry of Agriculture and Food Security (MAFS) ensure chicken and egg prices remain affordable to the B60 while also meeting self-sufficiency needs? “As this dominance is alarming, the Malaysia Competition Commission should release its findings on cartel activities in the industry before the float is introduced, especially since the findings have been pending for too long now,” he said in a statement, without naming those eight companies

    “As such, transparency is key, and the responsibility is on the government to make all information public,” he concluded

    Currently, the government has imposed price controls to only allow the maximum retail selling price in peninsular Malaysia for chicken to be at RM9.40 per kg, and the highest allowed selling price for eggs to be at 45 sen (Grade A), 43 sen (Grade B) and 41 sen (Grade C)

    The maximum selling price in Langkawi, Labuan, Sabah and Sarawak depends on the different zones and districts there.

    ['chicken', 'egg', 'per', 'malaysia', 'government']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 23 — Former Klang MP Charles Santiago today questioned how chicken and eggs can remain affordable for the B60 or those in the bottom 60 per cent income tier in Malaysia if the government removes the maximum selling price after June, given that just a few companies dominate production of these food items

    He called for transparency in the government’s removal of price controls or plan to float the prices of chicken and eggs

    “Given that eight firms control 65 per cent of production, how will the Ministry of Agriculture and Food Security (MAFS) ensure chicken and egg prices remain affordable to the B60 while also meeting self-sufficiency needs? “As this dominance is alarming, the Malaysia Competition Commission should release its findings on cartel activities in the industry before the float is introduced, especially since the findings have been pending for too long now,” he said in a statement, without naming those eight companies

    “As such, transparency is key, and the responsibility is on the government to make all information public,” he concluded

    Currently, the government has imposed price controls to only allow the maximum retail selling price in peninsular Malaysia for chicken to be at RM9.40 per kg, and the highest allowed selling price for eggs to be at 45 sen (Grade A), 43 sen (Grade B) and 41 sen (Grade C)

    The maximum selling price in Langkawi, Labuan, Sabah and Sarawak depends on the different zones and districts there.

    ['chicken', 'egg', 'per', 'malaysia', 'government']



  • STOCKS MOVING IN AFTER-HOURS: NVIDIA, LUCID, ETSY, BUMBLE

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/stocks-moving-in-after-hours-nvidia-lucid-etsy-bumble-225038026.html

    81.25% Shortened!

    Bumble’s fourth-quarter revenue grew 16% year over year to $241.6 million versus estimates of $235.8 million

    Bumble’s total paying users grew 15% year over year to 3.4 million, versus Wall Street expectations of 3 million

    Etsy’s fourth quarter revenue of a record $807.2 million beat Wall Street expectations of $753.7 million, while earnings per share came in at 77 cents versus a consensus estimate of 78 cents

    The analyst sees the company as "one of the stronger performers in e-commerce." Lucid’s fourth quarter revenue of $257.7 million missed Wall Street expectations of $314.9 million

    Lucid’s production announcement for this year came as a disappointment for Wall Street

    Ines is a senior business reporter for Yahoo Finance

    ['come', 'wall', 'street', 'stock', 'company']

  • UK GOVERNMENT CONFIRMS INDEPENDENT FOOTBALL REGULATOR PLAN

    https://www.espn.co.uk/football/english-premier-league/story/4884540/uk-government-confirms-plan-for-independent-football-regulator

    02/23/2023, 08:07

    57.14% Shortened!

    A seismic shake-up of the governance of English football, including the creation on an independent regulator for the elite game, will move closer with the publication of a wide-ranging government white paper on Thursday

    It would also have the power to prevent English clubs from joining breakaway competitions such as the European Super League, which six Premier League clubs signalled their intent to join in 2021 before abandoning plans after a fans' backlash

    "These bold new plans will put fans back at the heart of football and protect the rich heritage and traditions of our much-loved clubs." The Premier League, which has argued against the need for an independent regulator, said the white paper was a "significant moment" for English football, while the Football Association welcomed the commitment to improve the "financial sustainability and governance of professional clubs." Among the powers of the independent regulator would be to implement a licensing system from the Premier League down to the National League (fifth tier) and requiring clubs to demonstrate sound financial business models before being allowed to compete

    Although the Premier League, launched in 1992, has been an unprecedented financial success, lower down the English pyramid the situation has been grim

    The Premier League said it recognised the case for change in football governance and would carefully consider the government's plan for England to become the "first major nation to make football a government-regulated industry." It insists it has taken action to address issues raised in the Fan-Led Review and that £1.6bn is being reinvested down the pyramid over the next three seasons

    "We will now work constructively with stakeholders to ensure that the proposed government regulator does not lead to any unintended consequences that could affect the Premier League's position as the most-watched football league in the world, reduce its competitiveness or put the unrivalled levels of funding we provide at risk," the Premier League said

    ['football', 'government', 'say', 'club', 'league']

    A seismic shake-up of the governance of English football, including the creation on an independent regulator for the elite game, will move closer with the publication of a wide-ranging government white paper on Thursday

    It would also have the power to prevent English clubs from joining breakaway competitions such as the European Super League, which six Premier League clubs signalled their intent to join in 2021 before abandoning plans after a fans' backlash

    "These bold new plans will put fans back at the heart of football and protect the rich heritage and traditions of our much-loved clubs." The Premier League, which has argued against the need for an independent regulator, said the white paper was a "significant moment" for English football, while the Football Association welcomed the commitment to improve the "financial sustainability and governance of professional clubs." Among the powers of the independent regulator would be to implement a licensing system from the Premier League down to the National League (fifth tier) and requiring clubs to demonstrate sound financial business models before being allowed to compete

    Although the Premier League, launched in 1992, has been an unprecedented financial success, lower down the English pyramid the situation has been grim

    The Premier League said it recognised the case for change in football governance and would carefully consider the government's plan for England to become the "first major nation to make football a government-regulated industry." It insists it has taken action to address issues raised in the Fan-Led Review and that £1.6bn is being reinvested down the pyramid over the next three seasons

    "We will now work constructively with stakeholders to ensure that the proposed government regulator does not lead to any unintended consequences that could affect the Premier League's position as the most-watched football league in the world, reduce its competitiveness or put the unrivalled levels of funding we provide at risk," the Premier League said

    ['football', 'government', 'say', 'club', 'league']

  • HEALTH MINISTER MEETS 400 DOCTORS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/23/health-minister-meets-400-doctors

    02/23/2023, 08:07

    72.73% Shortened!

    A representative from Hartal Doktor Kontrak described the meeting as a good start

    “It was generally a good meeting between the Health Minister and doctors, coordinated by the Malaysian Medical Association (MMA)

    “A lot of issues were raised and the minister gave her assurance she would investigate (the issues raised) and try to resolve them,” said a spokesman for the movement after the meeting yesterday evening

    During the meeting, the minister told doctors present to look out for the announcement which will be made by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim during Budget 2023 that will be retabled tomorrow

    The townhall meeting came after repeated calls from healthcare groups for a meeting with Dr Zaliha since her appointment in December

    Dr Zaliha tweeted yesterday that those attending the townhall need not fear any repercussions

    ['doctor', 'minister', 'zaliha', 'meeting', 'say']

    75.0% Shortened!

    Ameer Ali, however, said currently, there is not enough supply of chicken and eggs in the market

    “Price control of both items is not very fair to producers,” he said

    However, should the price be floated, Ng said it would need to benefit both consumers and producers

    “Floating the price will impact both groups

    On the timing after June, Mohideen said it would be enough for the government to prepare the groundwork

  • PAS YOUTH’S ‘WAR’ PARADE COULD LET ANWAR GOVT BURNISH MODERATION CREDENTIALS, ANALYSTS SAY

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/23/pas-youths-war-parade-could-let-anwar-govt-burnish-moderation-credentials-analysts-say/56272

    02/23/2023, 08:07

    79.31% Shortened!

    After public anxiety emerged over the parade, Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail told the Islamist party that such concern was natural given the war-themed elements and messaging that accompanied the event

    “PAS can say it’s a normal procession or liken it to a Chinese opera but because of them using race and religion to campaign it (the Himpit parade) could be a camouflage to gain more votes

    “And the mainstreaming of such non-peaceful socio-political downward spiral would typically start with condoning public demonstration of non-peaceful exuberance

    He said by choosing to use Islamic symbols, their parade had caused members of the public to raise their concerns that the parade could cause racial disharmony

    Giving the party the benefit of the doubt, he said it could also be just organisers in the Marang PAS division who wanted to parade themselves as medieval warriors

    He also said authorities should not overreact to public concern over the parade and crack down excessively without justification

    ['could', 'parade', 'pa', 'political', 'say']

    After public anxiety emerged over the parade, Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail told the Islamist party that such concern was natural given the war-themed elements and messaging that accompanied the event

    “PAS can say it’s a normal procession or liken it to a Chinese opera but because of them using race and religion to campaign it (the Himpit parade) could be a camouflage to gain more votes

    “And the mainstreaming of such non-peaceful socio-political downward spiral would typically start with condoning public demonstration of non-peaceful exuberance

    He said by choosing to use Islamic symbols, their parade had caused members of the public to raise their concerns that the parade could cause racial disharmony

    Giving the party the benefit of the doubt, he said it could also be just organisers in the Marang PAS division who wanted to parade themselves as medieval warriors

  • SANIA MIRZA: INDIA TENNIS ICON WHO SHOWED HATE COULD BE DEFEATED

    https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-64728357

    02/23/2023, 07:07

    86.96% Shortened!

    Statistically, Sania Mirza may be no match for all-time greats like Serena Williams, but it's hard to overstate the tennis star's impact on sport in India, especially for women

    Mirza lost the match but her career embodying not just tennis but women's sport in India had taken off

    "Every time I play in India, there is a problem," she told reporters

    It's a testament to how Mirza managed unapologetically to dismantle notions about what she should or shouldn't do

    "That's the question I face all the time as a woman, that all women have to face - the first is marriage and then it's motherhood

    "She always thought that you can fight the odds." Mirza's tennis career may have come to an end but her legacy as a sportswoman looks far from over

    ['mirza', 'time', 'tennis', 'india', 'woman']

  • GOVERNMENT URGED TO TACKLE RISING MATERIAL COSTS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/23/government-urged-to-tackle-rising-material-costs

    02/23/2023, 07:07

    87.23% Shortened!

    “We would also like to see compliance costs (charges imposed by utility companies or local authorities) to be reviewed or reduced,” added Tong

    Tong said this was because many developers believe that it will take time for the market to fully recover

    “Also, depending on the location of their projects, many developers feel that the market isn’t quite there yet or hasn’t reached the sales price that would make sense for them to launch.” Tong said rising inflation is also a concern for many developers

    “Some developers may not be able to anticipate how much the cost increase is going to be, so they may prefer to wait and see before making a decision on how much they want to launch

    “On the other hand, there are also tailwinds

    It’s also about sentiment

    ['developer', 'cost', 'market', 'tong', 'say']

    “We would also like to see compliance costs (charges imposed by utility companies or local authorities) to be reviewed or reduced,” added Tong

    Tong said this was because many developers believe that it will take time for the market to fully recover

    “Also, depending on the location of their projects, many developers feel that the market isn’t quite there yet or hasn’t reached the sales price that would make sense for them to launch.” Tong said rising inflation is also a concern for many developers

    “Some developers may not be able to anticipate how much the cost increase is going to be, so they may prefer to wait and see before making a decision on how much they want to launch

    “On the other hand, there are also tailwinds

    It’s also about sentiment

    ['developer', 'cost', 'market', 'tong', 'say']



  • ‘TIP OF THE NEGATIVE EQUITY ICEBERG’: A RECORD NUMBER OF AMERICANS ARE GRAPPLING WITH $1,000 CAR PAYMENTS AND DRIVERS CAN'T KEEP PACE — STAY AHEAD BY DODGING THESE 2 LOAN MISTAKES

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/tip-negative-equity-iceberg-record-173000474.html

    80.65% Shortened!

    As your monthly car costs increase, you can dodge a debt default by avoiding two common auto loan mistakes

    Despite the fact that car prices started to cool off by the end of 2022, a concerning trend of auto loan defaults and car repossessions has started to surface

    There are ways to save money as the cost of car ownership grows more cumbersome

    For example, if you have $15,000 left to pay on your auto loan and your car is now worth $10,000, that means you have negative equity of $5,000 that you still have to pay

    If you can’t pay off your old auto loan out of pocket, you’ll have to roll the negative equity over to your new loan

    The older your car, the more likely you’ll have to spend money on repairs and maintenance in addition to your monthly loan payments

    ['pay', 'month', 'car', 'payment', 'year']

    As your monthly car costs increase, you can dodge a debt default by avoiding two common auto loan mistakes

    Despite the fact that car prices started to cool off by the end of 2022, a concerning trend of auto loan defaults and car repossessions has started to surface

    There are ways to save money as the cost of car ownership grows more cumbersome

    For example, if you have $15,000 left to pay on your auto loan and your car is now worth $10,000, that means you have negative equity of $5,000 that you still have to pay

    If you can’t pay off your old auto loan out of pocket, you’ll have to roll the negative equity over to your new loan

    The older your car, the more likely you’ll have to spend money on repairs and maintenance in addition to your monthly loan payments

    ['pay', 'month', 'car', 'payment', 'year']

    https://www.espn.co.uk/football/report/_/gameId/656855

    02/23/2023, 07:07

    73.91% Shortened!

    Substitute Romelu Lukaku volleyed an 86th-minute winner to earn Inter Milan a 1-0 victory over Porto in the first leg of their Champions League round-of-16 tie on Wednesday

    Porto midfielder Otavio was sent off 12 minutes from time and Belgian striker Lukaku took full advantage to boost Inter's bid to qualify for the quarterfinals of Europe's premier club competition for the first time in 12 years

    Alessandro Bastoni was close to giving Inter the lead in first-half stoppage time, but his downward header was expertly saved by Porto keeper Diogo Costa

    Porto host Inter in the second leg on March 14

    A tale of two halves for Pep Guardiola's side, as Manchester City were happy to leave Leipzig with a first-leg draw after a dour defensive display

    62.5% Shortened!

    Lucid shares are sliding following the EV-maker's huge revenue miss for the quarter, though it did report a smaller loss than expected

    Last month Lucid announced it produced 3,493 vehicles for the quarter and 7,180 for the year, topping its forecast of 6,000-7,000 vehicles for the year, however that forecast had been slashed multiple times last year

    Lucid’s original forecast for 2022 had them building 20,000 vehicles for the year

    Looking ahead, Lucid sees Q1 revenue of $600 - $640 million, versus $621.61 million estimated

    Lucid also forecasts its 2023 production to be 10,000 - 14,000 vehicles

    The PIF’s stake in Lucid sits at approximately 65%

    If the foundation sells, it only pays 1.39% excise tax on the capital gains

    Lifetime gift tax exclusion, which is separate from the annual gift

    ”A lot of people move to avoid state income tax,” Brewer said

    Here's why and what you need to do to find out if you're owed What is OASDI tax on my paycheck? Here's why you and your employer pay this federal tax Do you have to report crypto on taxes? Yes

    How much is the Child Tax Credit for 2023? Here's what you need to know about qualifying

    ['tax', 'year', 'avoid', 'estate', 'know']

  • MY PORTFOLIO IN APPROACHING $1 MILLION. WILL I BE ABLE TO LIVE OFF THE INTEREST IT PRODUCES?

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/much-interest-earn-1-million-150000229.html

    92.5% Shortened!

    Investors tend to seek interest-bearing investment not just because they tend to be more secure than other investment, but because they tend to be more knowable

    The coupon rate is the interest that the bond will pay on that debt in the meantime

    Bonds tend to offer the highest rate of return on any interest investment

    At the shortest, the average interest rate on a 30 day certificate of deposit is currently 0.03%, roughly that of a checking account

    At the longest, five year CDs offer an average interest rate of 0.39%

    Checking accounts, which have the most liquidity, pay an average 0.03% interest rate at the time of writing

    ['return', 'average', 'year', 'investment', 'interest']

    Investors tend to seek interest-bearing investment not just because they tend to be more secure than other investment, but because they tend to be more knowable

    The coupon rate is the interest that the bond will pay on that debt in the meantime

    Bonds tend to offer the highest rate of return on any interest investment

    At the shortest, the average interest rate on a 30 day certificate of deposit is currently 0.03%, roughly that of a checking account

    At the longest, five year CDs offer an average interest rate of 0.39%

    Checking accounts, which have the most liquidity, pay an average 0.03% interest rate at the time of writing

  • TWO DEAD, MORE THAN 50 MISSING IN CHINA MINE COLLAPSE

    https://www.thesundaily.my/world/two-dead-more-than-50-missing-in-china-mine-collapse-FA10670630

    02/23/2023, 00:07

    68.42% Shortened!

    State broadcaster CCTV said a collapse occurred at a mine in the western part of the Alxa League region around lunchtime, with other outlets and government agencies describing it as a “landslide”

    “Currently, the incident has caused the deaths of two people and injured six, with 53 missing,“ CCTV said in a social media post

    CCTV reported earlier on Wednesday that the incident had affected a “wide area” of an open-pit mine operated by the Xinjing Coal Mining Company

    Chinese President Xi Jinping has instructed authorities to “do everything possible to search for and rescue the missing people”, CCTV reported

    Eight rescue teams comprising more than 330 personnel have been sent to the site in the Luanjingtan ecological zone, along with more than 100 pieces of rescue equipment, the government of Alxa League said in a statement

    Some 40 people were working underground when a gold mine in the northwestern Xinjiang region collapsed in December

    ['people', 'medium', 'collapse', 'coal', 'mine']

    Barcelona were struggling to play out from the back

    02/22/2023, 21:08

    53.85% Shortened!

    Netflix today officially announced a price update for the Basic Plan in Malaysia

    In fact, this is the lowest monthly price for the streaming service’s Basic Plan to date as the tier was priced much higher at RM33 when Netflix made its official debut in Malaysia back in 2016

    The new pricing is yet another major update that Netflix has implemented on the Basic Plan for Malaysian customers within just a few months

    The new price has since been reflected on Netflix’s signup page as well as its Help Centre for Malaysia

    As for existing Basic Plan subscribers in Malaysia, Netflix said that the price update will be reflected in their billing in the coming weeks

    Furthermore, the Netflix Basic with Ads plan remains unavailable in Malaysia as noted in the service’s Help Centre

    On Tuesday night, Real Madrid highlighted Liverpool's fragility by finding the net five times

    "All the times we are able to move from the pressure of Liverpool, we were dangerous," said Carlo Ancelotti after the bout, referencing how Real Madrid caused problems for Klopp's men whenever they progressed beyond the team's front six players

    The make-up of Liverpool's attack and midfield is very different in comparison to previous seasons

    Liverpool's squad dynamic has shifted under Klopp's nose and for things to improve as they did upon his appointment in 2015, the German must once again teach his players how to defend from front to back.

  • PROSECUTION SAYS NO MISCARRIAGE OF JUSTICE AS ADJOURNMENT IS NOT MATTER OF RIGHT IN NAJIB'S SRC REVIEW HEARING

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/node/656280

    02/22/2023, 19:08

    80.65% Shortened!

    Sithambaram further said that granting postponement is at the court’s discretion and the Federal Court has an inherent jurisdiction on whether to grant it or otherwise, and the apex court should not be faulted if it did not grant it

    “The prosecution says the refusal by the Federal Court to grant an adjournment is an exercise of discretion by the court and not reviewable under Rule 137 of the Federal Court Rules 1995

    The Federal Court’s decision not to grant an adjournment does not contravene Najib’s right under Article 5 of the Federal Constitution

    Rule 137 of the Federal Court rules provides the apex court with an inherent jurisdiction to review a particular decision to prevent injustice or to prevent abuse of the process of the Court

    All of us come to court prepared, and we always have a plan B, in case the court does not grant anything

    Sithambaram further said that it was Najib’s own doing which had resulted in the court not granting the adjournment, as Najib knew four months before the appeal hearing date that the dates had been fixed

    ['datuk', 'najib', 'court', 'adjournment', 'say']

    Sithambaram further said that granting postponement is at the court’s discretion and the Federal Court has an inherent jurisdiction on whether to grant it or otherwise, and the apex court should not be faulted if it did not grant it

    “The prosecution says the refusal by the Federal Court to grant an adjournment is an exercise of discretion by the court and not reviewable under Rule 137 of the Federal Court Rules 1995

    The Federal Court’s decision not to grant an adjournment does not contravene Najib’s right under Article 5 of the Federal Constitution

    Rule 137 of the Federal Court rules provides the apex court with an inherent jurisdiction to review a particular decision to prevent injustice or to prevent abuse of the process of the Court

    All of us come to court prepared, and we always have a plan B, in case the court does not grant anything

    Sithambaram further said that it was Najib’s own doing which had resulted in the court not granting the adjournment, as Najib knew four months before the appeal hearing date that the dates had been fixed

    ['datuk', 'najib', 'court', 'adjournment', 'say']



  • GAMUDA TO ACQUIRE RM636MIL AUSTRALIAN TRANSPORT PROJECTS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/22/gamuda-to-acquire-rm636mil-australian-transport-projects

    02/22/2023, 19:07

    62.5% Shortened!

    Downer Transport Projects (DTP) is a distinct business unit under Downer that provides civil construction services in delivering transport projects for its customers, with specialist rail capability

    Some of the key projects currently carried out by DTP are in relation to rail line upgrades and duplication, rail extension, rail maintenance, service signalling and communication maintenance, and freeway upgrades

    The DTP acquisition is a strategic move for Gamuda and is in line with its growth plan of achieving A$3 billion in revenue annually in Australia within the next two to three years

    "With the acquisition, Gamuda will be tapping DTP’s in-house capabilities and track record namely track infrastructure, light rail, stations, rail overhead lines, signalling, communications and integration, rail maintenance, specialist plant services and road and bridge construction,” the group said

    It added that the consolidated capability and additional construction pipeline from DT Infrastructure across Australia will reinforce Gamuda’s position as they expand market reach in Australia by venturing into wider rail disciplines

    "Gamuda will be well positioned to participate in a larger pipeline of transport projects focusing on rail, light rail and rail systems, with an established network of subcontractors,” it said

    ['gamuda', 'australia', 'transport', 'project', 'dtp']

    Downer Transport Projects (DTP) is a distinct business unit under Downer that provides civil construction services in delivering transport projects for its customers, with specialist rail capability

    Some of the key projects currently carried out by DTP are in relation to rail line upgrades and duplication, rail extension, rail maintenance, service signalling and communication maintenance, and freeway upgrades

    The DTP acquisition is a strategic move for Gamuda and is in line with its growth plan of achieving A$3 billion in revenue annually in Australia within the next two to three years

    "With the acquisition, Gamuda will be tapping DTP’s in-house capabilities and track record namely track infrastructure, light rail, stations, rail overhead lines, signalling, communications and integration, rail maintenance, specialist plant services and road and bridge construction,” the group said

    It added that the consolidated capability and additional construction pipeline from DT Infrastructure across Australia will reinforce Gamuda’s position as they expand market reach in Australia by venturing into wider rail disciplines

    "Gamuda will be well positioned to participate in a larger pipeline of transport projects focusing on rail, light rail and rail systems, with an established network of subcontractors,” it said

    ['gamuda', 'australia', 'transport', 'project', 'dtp']

  • ASEAN CHAIR INDONESIA, CHINA TO INTENSIFY NEGOTIATIONS FOR SOUTH CHINA SEA CODE OF CONDUCT

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/asean-chair-indonesia-china-intensify-negotiations-south-china-sea-code-conduct-3296211

    02/22/2023, 19:06

    76.0% Shortened!

    “As littoral states in the South China Sea, Indonesia and China will work with other ASEAN member states to implement the declaration of conduct on the South China Sea and accelerate the negotiations for a code of conduct.” The ministers did not mention when the negotiations would take place but earlier this month, Mdm Marsudi had said that they would take place in March

    The South China Sea is one of the most contested waters in the world.  China claims much of the South China Sea based on a nine-dash line map it uses to claim the waters which Indonesia considers as lacking international legal basis

    ASEAN countries have been trying to negotiate a code of conduct with China since the 1990s

    Besides the South China Sea, the foreign ministers also talked about the Myanmar crisis.  Mdm Marsudi expressed her appreciation for China supporting the Five-Point of Consensus to end the violence in Myanmar following the February 2021 coup.  “The Five-Point of Consensus is the main reference for ASEAN to help Myanmar out of its political crisis,” she said referring to the consensus adopted by ASEAN leaders in Jakarta in April 2021

    During a meeting in April 2021, all ASEAN leaders reached a consensus about the situation in Myanmar

    He will also visit the ASEAN Secretariat during his stay.

    ['qin', 'say', 'indonesia', 'asean', 'china']

    “As littoral states in the South China Sea, Indonesia and China will work with other ASEAN member states to implement the declaration of conduct on the South China Sea and accelerate the negotiations for a code of conduct.” The ministers did not mention when the negotiations would take place but earlier this month, Mdm Marsudi had said that they would take place in March

    The South China Sea is one of the most contested waters in the world.  China claims much of the South China Sea based on a nine-dash line map it uses to claim the waters which Indonesia considers as lacking international legal basis

    ASEAN countries have been trying to negotiate a code of conduct with China since the 1990s

    During a meeting in April 2021, all ASEAN leaders reached a consensus about the situation in Myanmar

  • MACC LEADS JOINT OPERATION TO BUST SCAM SYNDICATE THAT RAKED IN MILLIONS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/22/macc-leads-joint-operation-to-bust-scam-syndicate-that-raked-in-millions

    02/22/2023, 17:08

    71.43% Shortened!

    He was stretchered off after the raid

    The raid, which was conducted simultaneously in Kuala Lumpur and Penang on Tuesday (Feb 21), was a joint operation involving the Immigration Department, Inland Revenue Board (LHDN) and Tenaga Nasional, among others

    "Surveillance was also obtained from MACC's partners in Australia and other foreign countries, as well as the MACC's AMLA (Anti-Terrorism Financing and Proceeds of Unlawful Activities) division," MACC chief commissioner Tan Sri Azam Baki told Sinar Harian on Tuesday

    Syndicate members included those from Australia, the United Kingdom, South Africa and the Philippines

    MACC's AMLA director Datuk Mohamad Zamri Zainul Abidin, told Sinar Harian that 11 suspects were arrested by the MACC and another 70 arrests by the Immigration Department

    During the raid at a call centre here, a New Zealand national tried to escape but was injured after he jumped the 14th floor and landed on the 11th floor in an attempt to escape arrest

    ['suspect', 'floor', 'raid', 'operation', 'macc']

    02/22/2023, 17:07

    83.78% Shortened!

    There’s a new look for the Independent Honda team, with the prospects that it will bring strong results on the track

    As the 2023 MOTUL FIM Superbike World Championship fires into life, there’ll be a new look for the MIE Honda Racing Team, as they ink a new deal with Malaysian energy company, Petronas, thus becoming the PETRONAS MIE Racing Honda Team

    In what is a “multi-year” deal, the new partnership ensures the growth of the team’s presence in the paddock as well as its sustainability

    I’m very confident in continuing with the same team, and both they and I will do our best to support each other, trust the process and continue to learn race by race

    This next season will be an important one for me and the team, and I’m excited to get started

    I’ll be facing some new tracks, but the team has data of course, so we’ll do our best to be as prepared as we can be

    ['new', 'honda', 'team', 'race', 'season']

  • LEGISLATION BEING DRAFTED TO CAP GOVT DEBT, SAYS AHMAD MASLAN

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/22/legislation-being-drafted-to-cap-govt-debt-says-ahmad-maslan

    02/22/2023, 16:08

    68.42% Shortened!

    The Deputy Finance Minister said the legislation was needed as the country had outstanding debt of about RM1.5 trillion

    "Among the components of the proposed law is that the government cannot incur debt for operating expenditure

    Ahmad said that under the Bill, the government would be allowed to borrow for development expenditure

    "We are also looking at capping the Federal Government's statutory debt to 65% of gross domestic product (GDP)," he added

    Ahmad said that this was because the government had previously raised the statutory debt limit twice – from 55% to 60% of GDP during the Covid-19 pandemic and once more last year to 65%

    "Previously, debt service charges used to be between 9% and 11% but this has risen to between 14% and 15%," he said

    ['debt', 'gdp', 'say', 'ahmad', 'government']

    "We are also looking at capping the Federal Government's statutory debt to 65% of gross domestic product (GDP)," he added

    Ahmad said that this was because the government had previously raised the statutory debt limit twice – from 55% to 60% of GDP during the Covid-19 pandemic and once more last year to 65%

    "Previously, debt service charges used to be between 9% and 11% but this has risen to between 14% and 15%," he said

    ['debt', 'gdp', 'say', 'ahmad', 'government']



  • REHDA: HOME BUYERS TO SEE SPIKE IN HOUSING PRICE AS CONSTRUCTION, LABOUR COST INCREASE

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/22/rehda-home-buyers-to-see-spike-in-housing-price-as-construction-labour-cost-increase/56193

    02/22/2023, 16:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    Its president Datuk NK Tong said among the biggest issue found in their reports are the high cost of building materials as well as increasing labour costs which saw the average increase of construction cost to 17 per cent in the second half of 2022 (2H 2022)

    He said the economy now is also “inflationary” and will remain so for a while, thus cost will remain high

    However, Tong did not reveal how much increase housing developers had asked, only that it will be a “two digit” in percentage increase

    However, the developers are seen to be more optimistic in 2H 2022 with 66 per cent of respondents stating that they are optimistic with another 4 per cent, very optimistic, compared to 55 per cent optimistic and 3 per cent very optimistic in the first half last year

    2H 2022 also saw the launching of 9,669 units, an increase of 23 per cent from 7,843 units in 1H 2022

    However 61 per cent of the respondents reported that they have unsold residential units with the majority of them priced above RM1 million

    ['say', 'increase', 'cost', 'per', 'cent']

    Its president Datuk NK Tong said among the biggest issue found in their reports are the high cost of building materials as well as increasing labour costs which saw the average increase of construction cost to 17 per cent in the second half of 2022 (2H 2022)

    He said the economy now is also “inflationary” and will remain so for a while, thus cost will remain high

    However, Tong did not reveal how much increase housing developers had asked, only that it will be a “two digit” in percentage increase

    However, the developers are seen to be more optimistic in 2H 2022 with 66 per cent of respondents stating that they are optimistic with another 4 per cent, very optimistic, compared to 55 per cent optimistic and 3 per cent very optimistic in the first half last year

    2H 2022 also saw the launching of 9,669 units, an increase of 23 per cent from 7,843 units in 1H 2022

    However 61 per cent of the respondents reported that they have unsold residential units with the majority of them priced above RM1 million

    Yasmin is a is a former resident of the welfare home

    "From what I can remember, Yasmin told the court that I told her to keep Bella tied up all the time, give the girl chilli and faeces to eat, splashed the girl with hot water, torture her with a hot pan and scolded the girl

    Siti Bainun was making her defence on charges of neglecting and abusing the 13-year-old Down syndrome girl

    The woman said she also had never ordered Yasmin and another former resident of Rumah Bonda, known as Aida, to ill-treat Bella or told them to splash hot water on the girl as she (Bella) had never caused her problems

    Questioned by Mohammad Farhan about Yasmin's statement that she (Siti Bainun) ordered her to feed Bella with chilli, Siti Bainun said such a thing had never happened to her wards

  • SYED SADDIQ CLAIMS TRIAL WAS POLITICALLY MOTIVATED, HAS RECORDING PROOF OF MACC OFFICER ADMITTING SO

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/22/syed-saddiq-claims-trial-was-politically-motivated-has-recording-proof-of-macc-officer-admitting-so/56199

    72.73% Shortened!

    Syed Saddiq, who took the stand today in day one of his criminal breach of trust and misappropriation of funds trial, said he also spoke to an MACC officer identified as Ihsan who admitted the agency was being used as a tool by the ruling government to prosecute their opponents

    “My friends were investigated by MACC and threatened by the officers to give their statement according to what the MACC wanted

    “In addition, throughout the investigation by MACC I was often interviewed by an officer called Ihsan

    In this trial Syed Saddiq has two charges pinned against him, charges of abetting in criminal breach of trust (CBT), misappropriation of assets and money laundering

    According to the first charge, Syed Saddiq, 30, is charged as the then Bersatu Youth wing or Armada chief - who was entrusted with control of Armada funds - of abetting Rafiq, Armada’s assistant treasurer at the time, with CBT of RM1 million in funds belonging to the wing

    Syed Saddiq is accused of committing the offence at a bank in Jalan Persisiran Perling, Taman Perling, Johor Baru, on June 16 and 19, 2018.

  • REHDA SURVEY SHOWS 51% OF DEVELOPERS NOT LAUNCHING NEW PROJECTS AS HOMEBUYERS FACE END FINANCING CHALLENGE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/22/rehda-survey-shows-51-of-developers-not-launching-new-projects-as-homebuyers-face-end-financing-challenge

    02/22/2023, 16:06

    72.73% Shortened!

    Tong said that based on current sentiment, 94 per cent of developers in its survey attributed that having access to end financing for homebuyers continue to be the main challenge for homebuyers

    "About 68 per cent of respondents expect building material costs will continue to trend higher for another 12 months at least until they stabilise

    "To counter the price increase in building materials, developers have no choice but to increase property selling prices (double digit on average) or lower their profit margin,” said Tong

    Tong said 61 per cent of respondents had planned to launch their projects in 1H 2023, but the majority (83 per cent) viewed that their sales performance would record 50 per cent and below

    This was supported by the optimism in the domestic economic environment sentiment of 70 per cent in 2H 2023 against 51 per cent in 1H 2023, and higher consumer purchasing power of 60 per cent in 2H 2023 from 44 per cent in 1H 2023 in the survey

    To boost sales for the 1H 2023, he said, the survey outlined three top measures that include aggressive participation in digital marketing and virtual technology; assist with first 10 per cent in downpayment; and offer special rebates namely for second property purchased from the same developer (referral rebates)

    ['tong', 'developer', 'per', 'cent', 'say']

    Tong said that based on current sentiment, 94 per cent of developers in its survey attributed that having access to end financing for homebuyers continue to be the main challenge for homebuyers

    "About 68 per cent of respondents expect building material costs will continue to trend higher for another 12 months at least until they stabilise

    "To counter the price increase in building materials, developers have no choice but to increase property selling prices (double digit on average) or lower their profit margin,” said Tong

    Tong said 61 per cent of respondents had planned to launch their projects in 1H 2023, but the majority (83 per cent) viewed that their sales performance would record 50 per cent and below

    This was supported by the optimism in the domestic economic environment sentiment of 70 per cent in 2H 2023 against 51 per cent in 1H 2023, and higher consumer purchasing power of 60 per cent in 2H 2023 from 44 per cent in 1H 2023 in the survey

    To boost sales for the 1H 2023, he said, the survey outlined three top measures that include aggressive participation in digital marketing and virtual technology; assist with first 10 per cent in downpayment; and offer special rebates namely for second property purchased from the same developer (referral rebates)

    ['tong', 'developer', 'per', 'cent', 'say']



  • THREE TEENS CHARGED WITH RAPING 12-YEAR-OLD GIRL IN BAHAU

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/22/three-under-aged-teens-charged-with-raping-12-year-old-girl-in-bahau

    02/22/2023, 15:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    The accused, aged 14, 16 and 17, pleaded not guilty after the charge was read to them before Magistrate Norshazwani Ishak

    The 14- and 17-year-old youths were charged with raping the victim around 11.30pm on Jan 28 while the 16-year-old allegedly committed the crime between 3am and 1pm the following day

    The two youths who jointly committed the crime were charged under Section 375B of the Penal Code while the third was charged under Section 376 (2)(d) of the same legislation

    Those found guilty of an offence under Section 375B or Section 376(2)(d) of the Penal Code can be imprisoned for a sentence between 10 and 30 years and shall also be liable to whipping upon conviction

    The youths who were jointly charged were each represented by Datuk Abu Bakar Isa Ramat and Datuk PM Nagarajan while the third suspect was unrepresented

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['bahau', 'court', 'year', 'old', 'charge']

    The accused, aged 14, 16 and 17, pleaded not guilty after the charge was read to them before Magistrate Norshazwani Ishak

    The 14- and 17-year-old youths were charged with raping the victim around 11.30pm on Jan 28 while the 16-year-old allegedly committed the crime between 3am and 1pm the following day

    The two youths who jointly committed the crime were charged under Section 375B of the Penal Code while the third was charged under Section 376 (2)(d) of the same legislation

    Those found guilty of an offence under Section 375B or Section 376(2)(d) of the Penal Code can be imprisoned for a sentence between 10 and 30 years and shall also be liable to whipping upon conviction

    The youths who were jointly charged were each represented by Datuk Abu Bakar Isa Ramat and Datuk PM Nagarajan while the third suspect was unrepresented

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['bahau', 'court', 'year', 'old', 'charge']



  • DR WEE ASKS NANTA FOR DETAILS OF NSE EXPANSION AT YONG PENG

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/22/dr-wee-asks-nanta-for-details-of-nse-expansion-at-yong-peng

    02/22/2023, 15:06

    57.14% Shortened!

    Wednesday, 22 Feb 2023

    The MCA president used a short poem to ask Works Minister Datuk Seri Alexander Nanta Linggi about the status of the much-needed project during a Parliament session on Wednesday (Feb 23)

    Nanta then replied that the proposal had been reviewed by the ministry which is also in agreement that the expansion is needed for the four-lane highway

    "The first phase will be the construction of an additional lane for both sides of the highway from Yong Peng Utara to Sedenak as part of Rolling Plan 3 (RP3)

    Dr Wee then asked when the construction of the new lanes was likely to begin, and Nanta replied it would start very soon if approved and included in Budget 2023 by the Finance Ministry

    "We sent our proposal to the Finance Ministry for review but the approval for the allocation of the funding needed will be subject to the priority and financial status of the government in Budget 2023," Nanta said.

    ['nse', 'lane', 'expansion', 'yong', 'peng']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 22 — Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin has today confirmed the resignation Datuk Wan Saiful Wan Jan as Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (Bersatu) information chief from today, The Bersatu president however said this decision is not an acknowledgement that Wan Saiful is guilty

    He himself volunteered to hand in his resignation, I appreciate his decision

    Earlier this morning, Wan Saiful had offered to relinquish his information chief post in the party due to his ongoing court case

    He added that his position as the information chief is an executive position, it was rightful that he relinquished it until he is able to prove his innocence

    Yesterday, Wan Saiful claimed trial for two bribery charges at the Sessions Court here, in connection with the government’s Jana Wibawa scheme back in 2022

    In the second charge, Wan Saiful was accused of receiving RM6,962,694.54 from Nepturis in relation to the same government road project

  • NAJIB COMPLICIT WITH LAWYERS IN TRYING TO GET SRC APPEAL ADJOURNED, SAYS PROSECUTOR

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/22/najib-complicit-with-lawyers-in-trying-to-get-src-appeal-adjourned-says-prosecutor

    02/22/2023, 14:09

    66.67% Shortened!

    Sithambaram said Najib had taken on new lawyers with the hope of postponing the hearing of the appeal and so the court had the right to refuse the adjournment sought

    The prosecutor, who was submitting in the review application by Najib in the SRC International case here on Wednesday (Feb 22), said it was obvious the new lawyer's appointment was only for an adjournment and that the new solicitors and counsel deliberately accepted the brief with the sole view of postponing a case that was set months earlier

    "There was no Plan B in the event the court did not allow the adjournment," he said

    Other judges were Federal Court judges Justices Vernon Ong Lam Kiat, Rhodzariah Bujang, Nordin Hassan and Court of Appeal judge Justice Abu Bakar Jais

    Najib is seeking to review the Federal Court's decision of Aug 23 which upheld the Kuala Lumpur High Court’s decision to convict and sentence him to 12 years in jail and a RM210mil fine in the RM42mil SRC International case

    On Sept 6, he applied for a review of the Federal Court’s decision, claiming a “miscarriage of justice” in his case

    ['najib', 'adjournment', 'appeal', 'src', 'court']

    A total of 2.6 million EPF members come from the T20 category, he added

    He said the total of EPF funds from the bottom 40 per cent of income earners (B40) in April 2020 was RM13 billion, which fell by 46 per cent to RM7 billion last December

    There were 5.2 million B40 EPF members, he added

    Ahmad said the total amount of funds from the country’s middle 40 per cent if income earners (M40) similarly fell by 28 per cent from RM191 billion in April 2020 to RM138 billion in December 2022

    M40 EPF members also numbered 5.2 million

  • PROSECUTION SAYS NO MISCARRIAGE OF JUSTICE AS ADJOURNMENT IS NOT A MATTER OF RIGHT IN NAJIB'S SRC REVIEW HEARING

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/node/656280

    02/22/2023, 14:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    He further said that granting postponement is the court’s discretion and the Federal Court had an inherent jurisdiction on whether to grant it or otherwise, and the apex court should not be faulted if it did not grant it

    This is in no way the fault of the court, as in prior two case managements and two previous correspondences, the apex court indicated (that) there would not be any adjournment,” he added

    “The granting of adjournment is not how it works on assurance by counsel

    The solicitor should not mislead Najib that adjournment be granted as off right

    All of us come to court prepared and we always have a plan B, in case the court does not grant anything

    Sithambaram further said that it was Najib’s own doing which had resulted in the court not granting the adjournment, as Najib knew four months before the appeal hearing date that the dates had been fixed

    ['datuk', 'najib', 'case', 'court', 'adjournment']

    He further said that granting postponement is the court’s discretion and the Federal Court had an inherent jurisdiction on whether to grant it or otherwise, and the apex court should not be faulted if it did not grant it

    This is in no way the fault of the court, as in prior two case managements and two previous correspondences, the apex court indicated (that) there would not be any adjournment,” he added

    “The granting of adjournment is not how it works on assurance by counsel

    The solicitor should not mislead Najib that adjournment be granted as off right

    All of us come to court prepared and we always have a plan B, in case the court does not grant anything

    64.71% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 22 — The Independent Police Conduct Commission (IPCC) will be in force starting July 1, 2023, the Home Ministry said

    This was in response to DAP Kepong MP Lim Lip Eng’s question on the status of the establishment of the Independent Police Complaints and Misconduct Commission (IPCMC)

    The Bill was later replaced when Perikatan Nasional (PN) took the government, with the Independent Police Conduct Commission Bill

    The Home Ministry said it has plans to purchase 7,648 units of Body Worn Camera (BWC) with an estimation of RM2,000 to RM2,500 per unit

    Prior to that, in 2021, the previous government had approved an allocation of RM30 million under the 12th Malaysia Plan to purchase body cameras for the police

    However, three were detained for filming the police raid

    ['police', 'commission', 'say', 'government', 'bill']

    02/22/2023, 13:08

    66.67% Shortened!

    Currently, the cheapest Tesla on sale in Australia in the Model 3 RWD, which starts at AUD$64,300 (RM195,066) before on-road costs in the country

    That being said, the resemblance to the CX-30 could be more than just in its size, and could also turn out to be the Mazda crossover with lights from Tesla

    Tesla CEO Elon Musk previously announced in October 2022 that the EV maker is working on a next-generation platform that would be half the price of the Model 3 and Model Y, and a model that is set to be priced in the region of US$25,000 (RM111,025) is expected to make its debut in 2023, this year

    The idea of a more affordable Tesla model was put forth by Musk as early as 2018, at which time the CEO said the company could produce in three years from that time, or 2021

    When June 2021 rolled around, Musk said that the new model, which will be a hatchback, is planned for a 2023 debut

    One way that Tesla could manage costs with the new model is with its tabless 4680 battery cell design, which the company revealed at its Battery Day event in September 2020

    02/22/2023, 13:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    "During the teaching and learning (PdP) of History, as with all subjects, teachers conduct their lessons in an objective manner including on the general election

    Lim said the ministry has given supplementary assistance to help teachers conduct lessons on topics like the general election in the best way possible

    "Aside from that we also have videos on DidikTV and the ministry had broadcast topics specifically on the general election," she added

    To the initial question, Lim said the topic of the general election was specifically in the History subject while elements related to the conducting of the polls was in Civics education and other areas of the curriculum

    "In line with the level of education and age, students at secondary level are exposed more in-depth to politics as well as national and world history, national heritage and nation building," she said

  • WAN SAIFUL SAYS WILLING TO LET GO OF BERSATU INFO CHIEF POST AFTER BRIBERY CHARGES

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/22/wan-saiful-says-willing-to-let-go-of-bersatu-info-chief-post-after-bribery-charges/56167

    02/22/2023, 13:08

    60.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 22 — Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia’s Datuk Wan Saiful Wan Jan said today he has offered to relinquish his information chief position in the party due to his ongoing court case

    “But let this decision be made by the top leadership,” Wan Saiful told a press conference here at the Parliament building here

    He added that his position as the information chief is an executive position, it was rightful that he relinquished it until he is able to prove his innocence

    Yesterday, Wan Saiful claimed trial for two bribery charges at the Sessions Court here, in connection with the government’s Jana Wibawa scheme back in 2022

    In the second charge, Wan Saiful was accused of receiving RM6,962,694.54 from Nepturis in relation to the same government road project

    Sessions Court judge Azura Alwi set bail at RM400,000 and told Wan Saiful that he has to surrender his passport to the court before March 22.

    ['wan', 'saiful', 'say', 'information', 'chief']

    Yesterday, Wan Saiful claimed trial for two bribery charges at the Sessions Court here, in connection with the government’s Jana Wibawa scheme back in 2022

  • LRT SUSPENSION IN JAN DUE TO STRUCTURAL DAMAGES FROM CONSTRUCTION OF HOTEL NEXT TO BANDARAYA STATION, SAYS TRANSPORT MINISTER

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/22/lrt-suspension-in-jan-due-to-structural-damages-from-construction-of-hotel-next-to-bandaraya-station-says-transport-minister/56165

    02/22/2023, 13:06

    50.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 22 — The suspension of rail services since January was due to structural damage of the viaduct and cracked pier near the Bandaraya LRT station, Transport Minister Anthony Loke said today

    “As stated by the Land Public Transport Agency on January 27, the construction works started without any consultation with APAD under the Railway Regulations (Railway Protection Zone) 1998

    “The remedial work will take time as the investigation shows, damage to affected structures pose a very serious safety risk

    “Prasarana will as best as possible take mitigation measures to reduce service disruptions to users

    Asked if his ministry will take action against those who caused the damages that affected the rail system, Loke said the decision will be based on the final outcome of the investigation

    Following the train service disruption, Kuala Lumpur City Hall (DBKL) had on January 30, issued a stop-work order for the said construction site in Jalan Raja Laut with immediate effect

    ['service', 'january', 'damage', 'say', 'work']

  • NORTH KOREA PAPER CALLS OUTSIDE AID 'POISONED CANDY', URGES SELF-RELIANCE

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/north-korea-paper-calls-outside-aid-poisoned-candy-urges-self-reliance-3295281

    02/22/2023, 12:09

    62.5% Shortened!

    Most UN agencies and Western relief groups have since left North Korea, with China remaining one of the few sources of external food assistance

    "Food production dropped from last year, and there is a possibility of distribution issues due to a change in their food supply and distribution policy," a ministry official told reporters

    South Korea's rural development agency in December estimated the North's crop production at around 4.5 million tonnes last year, 3.8 per cent down from 2021, citing heavy summer rains and other weather conditions

    Unification Minister Kwon Young-se has said Pyongyang had asked the UN food agency, the World Food Programme, to provide support but there was no progress because of differences over monitoring issues

    The agency has not responded to a request for comment.

    By clicking subscribe, I agree to receive news updates and promotional material from Mediacorp and Mediacorp's partners.

  • SINGAPORE MAKER OF LAB-GROWN DIAMONDS WINS SEVEN-YEAR COURT BATTLE AGAINST DE BEERS FIRM

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2023/02/22/singapore-maker-of-lab-grown-diamonds-wins-seven-year-court-battle-against-de-beers-firm

    02/22/2023, 12:08

    80.0% Shortened!

    One patent was revoked by the High Court in 2020

    Last Friday, in a landmark decision which addressed novel points of patent law, the Court of Appeal ordered the second patent to be revoked as it was not sufficiently clear and complete

    One patent, identified as SG 508, relates to a method of changing the colour of a lab-grown diamond by heat treatment

    Under the Patents Act, a patent is valid only if it discloses the invention “in a manner which is clear and complete”

    The court found that the patent was not sufficiently clear, as it did not set out the method to allow a skilled person reading the patent to grow the lab-grown diamond

    The court found that the patent was also insufficient because it was “uncertain” – even if a skilled person grew a diamond, he would not know whether that diamond infringed Element Six’s patent.

    ['element', 'six', 'singapore', 'iia', 'patent']

    One patent was revoked by the High Court in 2020

    Last Friday, in a landmark decision which addressed novel points of patent law, the Court of Appeal ordered the second patent to be revoked as it was not sufficiently clear and complete

    One patent, identified as SG 508, relates to a method of changing the colour of a lab-grown diamond by heat treatment

    Under the Patents Act, a patent is valid only if it discloses the invention “in a manner which is clear and complete”

    The court found that the patent was not sufficiently clear, as it did not set out the method to allow a skilled person reading the patent to grow the lab-grown diamond

    The court found that the patent was also insufficient because it was “uncertain” – even if a skilled person grew a diamond, he would not know whether that diamond infringed Element Six’s patent.

    ['element', 'six', 'singapore', 'iia', 'patent']

    02/22/2023, 12:08

    66.67% Shortened!

    The company reaffirmed Malaysia’s BBB+ rating and stable outlook

    Malaysia expects the economy to expand between 4% to 5% this year, after a 22-year high in 2022

    “Performance legitimacy is paramount for the new and untested multi-coalition government,” said Firdaos Rosli of Bank Islam Malaysia Bhd

    The government will instead raise revenue by boosting tax collection via higher compliance, the survey findings showed

    With so much at stake, Anwar has indicated multiple times that he will stay largely faithful to the spending plan his predecessor unveiled in October last year

    The previous government had presented a tighter budget for 2023, while projecting weaker revenue and lower dividends penciled-in from state oil company Petroliam Nasional Bhd (Petronas)

    Anwar will likely maintain the budget size, as well as revenue levels, according to the majority of the analysts surveyed by Bloomberg

  • MALAYSIA RECORDS 84 MILLION CYBER ATTACKS PER DAY IN 4Q 2022: FORTINET

    https://www.thesundaily.my/local/malaysia-records-84-million-cyber-attacks-per-day-in-4q-2022-fortinet-IB10667924

    02/22/2023, 11:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    According to FortiGuard Labs, the cyber threats in Malaysia registered a total of 61.1 million virus detections, 50.2 million botnet attacks, and 7.5 billion exploit detections throughout 4Q 2022

    “(By comparison), cyber threats on the global scale in 4Q 2022 recorded around 200 billion attacks per day

    Jongvibool said that exploits have become the latest technique adopted by cyber attackers when they planted malware on their target’s devices while waiting for the right time to execute the attack

    He highlighted that Fortinet is now the provider of nearly half of the firewall deployments around the globe, a significant achievement and improvement over the past year

    “From the global perspective, we are able to show very detailed data of new techniques adopted by the attackers and how they plan their attack, with what kind of malware or exploit they are using right now,“ he added

    “Fortinet also pledged to provide training to one million people in cybersecurity by 2026, as we have achieved our initial target of one million people certified with Fortinet Network Security Expert (NSE) way before 2023,“ he added

    ['million', 'cyber', 'attack', 'cybersecurity', 'fortinet']

    According to FortiGuard Labs, the cyber threats in Malaysia registered a total of 61.1 million virus detections, 50.2 million botnet attacks, and 7.5 billion exploit detections throughout 4Q 2022

    “(By comparison), cyber threats on the global scale in 4Q 2022 recorded around 200 billion attacks per day

    Jongvibool said that exploits have become the latest technique adopted by cyber attackers when they planted malware on their target’s devices while waiting for the right time to execute the attack

    He highlighted that Fortinet is now the provider of nearly half of the firewall deployments around the globe, a significant achievement and improvement over the past year

    “From the global perspective, we are able to show very detailed data of new techniques adopted by the attackers and how they plan their attack, with what kind of malware or exploit they are using right now,“ he added

    “Fortinet also pledged to provide training to one million people in cybersecurity by 2026, as we have achieved our initial target of one million people certified with Fortinet Network Security Expert (NSE) way before 2023,“ he added

    “This is a war of industrial systems

    At the moment Russia is overmatched by the West

    Why would China get involved? Chinese military commentator Song Zhongping insisted China would not send arms, but said political, trade and military cooperation between Moscow and Beijing had deepened before the Ukraine war and would continue

    “China will not listen to the United States’ demands

    China will strengthen cooperation with Russia in accordance with its own national will and national security concerns,“ he said

    “If Russia is to lose in Ukraine politically or militarily, China will be left alone,“ he said

  • RIGHT TIMING FOR PETRONAS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/22/right-timing-for-petronas

    02/22/2023, 11:08

    82.86% Shortened!

    Investment advisers say a listing would offer many positives for the lacklustre local equity market

    Despite it being its golden goose and a listing would cause dilution, the government has said it would study the proposal, while investment advisers said a listing would offer many positives for the lacklustre local equity market

    “PETRONAS’ primary listing will have to be on Bursa Malaysia

    Bursa Malaysia may not be the ideal exchange for listing PETRONAS but PETRONAS will definitely be the ideal listing for Bursa Malaysia,” said high net worth investor and former investment banker Ian Yoong Kah Yin

    He pointed out that the potential PETRONAS listing could be exempted from the minimum public shareholding spread of 25% upon listing which was granted to MR DIY Group (M) Bhd

    The PETRONAS listing on Bursa Malaysia would bring down the market PER of 17.2 times for the FBM KLCI (in January) to about 13 times, Yoong said

    ['say', 'listing', 'would', 'local', 'market']

    Investment advisers say a listing would offer many positives for the lacklustre local equity market

    Saifuddin added that 19(0.81%) inmates were sentenced to death for kidnapping and three for gang robbery

    DKSH rose 14 sen to RM4.98, Bonia gained seven sen to RM2.69 and Hextar Technologies climbed 10 sen to RM25.20

    Top active counters included Hong Seng flat at 19 sen, Capital A up five sen to 72 sen and Bintai Kinden unchanged at 9.5 sen.

    02/22/2023, 10:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    Within minutes of the opening bell, the share soared 39.7% to an early morning high of 95 sen

    As at 9.25am, the stock was trading 18 sen or 26.47% higher at 86 sen a share on high volume of 18.76 million shares

    Yesterday, the long-haul budget carrier reported that its net profit in the three months to Dec 31, 2022, was RM153.5mil, representing an earnings per share of 37 sen, on revenue of RM339.3mil

    For the 18 months ended Dec 31, AAX posted a net profit of almost RM33bil, or earnings per share of 7951.20 sen

    At the time of writing, the share was trading 4.5 sen or 6.72% higher at 71.5 sen a share on the back of 25.23 million units exchanging hands.

  • BODY CAMERAS FOR COPS TO COST BETWEEN RM2,000 TO RM2,500 EACH, DEWAN RAKYAT TOLD

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/22/body-cameras-for-cops-to-cost-between-rm2000-to-rm2500-each-dewan-rakyat-told

    02/22/2023, 10:08

    60.0% Shortened!

    Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail

    According to Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail, RM30mil was allocated for the acquisition of Body Worn Camera (BWC) which will be fitted on officers across 157 district police headquarters nationwide

    “The BWC will be used by police officers stationed in the field, particularly the police patrol car units and the police motorcycle patrol units, as well as road patrols by the police in 157 district police headquarters nationwide

    Saifuddin also said the Independent Police Conduct Commission (IPCC) Act will be enforced beginning July 1

    The IPCC Act was passed in the Dewan Rakyat in July of last year and it will see the setting-up of an independent commission to monitor the integrity of the police force and probe complaints of misconduct involving police personnel

    Saifuddin was responding to Lim Lip Eng (PH-Kepong) who asked about the setting up of the IPCC and the breakdown of body cams that will be fitted on police officers

    ['saifuddin', 'nasution', 'body', 'camera', 'fit']

    Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail

    According to Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail, RM30mil was allocated for the acquisition of Body Worn Camera (BWC) which will be fitted on officers across 157 district police headquarters nationwide

    “The BWC will be used by police officers stationed in the field, particularly the police patrol car units and the police motorcycle patrol units, as well as road patrols by the police in 157 district police headquarters nationwide

    Saifuddin also said the Independent Police Conduct Commission (IPCC) Act will be enforced beginning July 1

    The IPCC Act was passed in the Dewan Rakyat in July of last year and it will see the setting-up of an independent commission to monitor the integrity of the police force and probe complaints of misconduct involving police personnel

    Saifuddin was responding to Lim Lip Eng (PH-Kepong) who asked about the setting up of the IPCC and the breakdown of body cams that will be fitted on police officers

    The keywords are ‘retirement benefits’ and it is not meant to be used before retirement

    Some people believe that because they have EPF savings, it is their right to use them

    They knew that early EPF withdrawal would harm the people but they simply didn’t care

    Coinbase Global shares jumped after the crypto exchange’s fourth-quarter revenue of $629.1 million came in above Wall Street expectations of $581.1 million

    Palo Alto Networks’ total revenue for the fiscal second quarter 2023 grew 26% year over year to $1.7 billion

    Year-to-date shares of the Palo Alto-based firm are up about 20% amid an overall rise in tech equities

    Toll Brothers posted first-quarter earnings per share of $1.70 compared to $1.24 for the same period last year

    Toll Brothers reaffirmed its full-year 2023 guidance for an adjusted gross margin of 27% and an earnings per share range between $8.00 and $9.00

    Ines is a senior business reporter for Yahoo Finance

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/22/wee-ensure-all-fully-understand-malaysia-madani-concept

    02/22/2023

    68.42% Shortened!

    Dr Wee, who is also the Ayer Hitam MP, said Malaysia Madani is a new concept espoused by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim that shares many universal values to form a progressive community in the context of a multiracial country

    To this, Anwar said Malaysia Madani is comprehensive and fair to all races

    He explained that although the root of the concept may come from Islamic thought and principles, the implementation of the concept will be fair to all Malaysians

    I did not say it is just for Dayak, Iban, Malays, Chinese or Kelantanese, or those in Tambun

    If it is hardcore poor, we will help all

    “I give my assurance that in Malaysia, the Malaysia Madani concept is for all Malaysians, and justice will be given to all,” he said.

    ['malaysia', 'madani', 'say', 'concept', 'anwar']

    Dr Wee, who is also the Ayer Hitam MP, said Malaysia Madani is a new concept espoused by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim that shares many universal values to form a progressive community in the context of a multiracial country

    To this, Anwar said Malaysia Madani is comprehensive and fair to all races

    He explained that although the root of the concept may come from Islamic thought and principles, the implementation of the concept will be fair to all Malaysians

    I did not say it is just for Dayak, Iban, Malays, Chinese or Kelantanese, or those in Tambun

    If it is hardcore poor, we will help all

    “I give my assurance that in Malaysia, the Malaysia Madani concept is for all Malaysians, and justice will be given to all,” he said.

    ['malaysia', 'madani', 'say', 'concept', 'anwar']

    Other people’s perceptions weigh heavily on the choice of paternity leave for new parents

    Towards parental parity? This is why Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong is thinking of making the extra two weeks of paid leave mandatory

    These include an increase in the baby bonus paid to new parents and an increase in the number of days of unpaid annual leave parents can take to care for an infant

    02/22/2023, 08:08

    72.73% Shortened!

    The 2010 AFF Cup champion and Golden Boot winner announced his retirement yesterday after a glorious 19 years in the M-League, which saw him win the Super League, FA Cup and Malaysia Cup multiple times

    The Kajang-born player also has the distinction of being the first Malaysian footballer to play in two Asian Football Confederation (AFC) Cup finals with JDT in 2015 (won) and KL City in 2022 (lost)

    He was also instrumental in helping Malaysia win the Asean Football Federation (AFF) Cup for the first time in 2010

    Malaysia have not won the AFF Cup since then

    Safee, who had scored 47 goals with Harimau Malaya and 136 goals at the club level, was choked with emotion as he pondered over his football journey

    I then came back to join JDT.’’ Commenting on his future plans, Safee said football will still remain a big part of his life

    ['safee', 'announce', 'football', 'cup', 'league']

    02/22/2023, 08:08

    76.92% Shortened!

    Most analysts do not think the vehicle sector can replicate the record-breaking sales in 2022, when the total industry volume hit 720,000 units

    “We estimate that the total current backlog order across all top key marques at above 300,000 units

    RHB Research, which recently upgraded its sector outlook to “overweight”, predicts the TIV for 2023 at 680,000 units

    “We think that the strong TIV figure will be supported by existing orders on hand, and by new launches this year

    RHB Research expects the motor vehicle sector to record strong 4Q22 and 1Q23 earnings, as companies are in the final stretch of fulfilling the SST-exempt orders before the end of June

    A more bullish Kenanga Research projected the sector’s TIV to hit 720,000 units, similar to last year
