    Arsenal midfielder Granit Xhaka was booked for his celebrations during the win at Villa Park Sign up to the free Arsenal newsletter so you don't miss the latest Gunners news, straight to your inbox We have more newsletters Arsenal secured a crucial 4-2 win over Aston Villa in their Premier League clash on Saturday afternoon

    Mikel Arteta's side had trailed twice at Villa Park before two injury-time goals clinched all three points, sending them back above Manchester City at the top of the league table

    Villa striker Ollie Watkins had broken the deadlock early on before Bukayo Saka's emphatic volley equalled things up after 16 minutes

    Central midfielder Granit Xhaka, who was substituted off in the second half, then sprinted off the Arsenal bench to go and celebrate with his teammates, clearly ecstatic that the away side were able to snatch all three points at the death

    Gabriel Martinelli also caused some headlines by celebrating before he had put the ball in the net for Arsenal's fourth goal - angering former Villa striker Gabriel Agbonlahor in the process

    “I didn't like Martinelli running through and celebrating before he puts the ball in the back of the net,” Agbonlahor told talkSport

  • CHINA’S CHIP SECTOR ENTERS A ‘DARK FOREST’ ERA

    https://asiatimes.com/2023/02/chinas-chip-sector-enters-a-dark-forest-era/

    02/21/2023

    79.31% Shortened!

    In a widely circulated article, a Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) academician and chip researcher say China’s chip sector has entered a “dark forest” without access to advanced US chip-making software and coming restrictions on deep ultraviolet (DUV) lithography tools made by Japan and the Netherlands

    “As Chinese chip makers could buy and use the PDK in the past, our decision-makers, government officials and industry players tended to think that China could develop its chip sector without fundamental research.” “But since the US turned off the ‘lighthouse,’ we have now entered a dark forest,” they wrote, referring to US blocks on selling advanced chip-making equipment to China

    The writers say China’s research and development investments in the sector represent less than 5% of US investments while China still lacks a proper institution to organize the industry’s developments

    Some Chinese IT writers and observers said they were surprised to read the CAS article’s dismal portrayal of China’s chip sector, which many said they didn’t think was so laggard

    So far China can still import DUV lithography machinery to make 28nm chips

    In October, it announced a new raft of chip export bans to block China from getting high-end chips and chip-making tools from the US

    ['china', 'research', 'chip', 'say', 'make']

    In a widely circulated article, a Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) academician and chip researcher say China’s chip sector has entered a “dark forest” without access to advanced US chip-making software and coming restrictions on deep ultraviolet (DUV) lithography tools made by Japan and the Netherlands

    “As Chinese chip makers could buy and use the PDK in the past, our decision-makers, government officials and industry players tended to think that China could develop its chip sector without fundamental research.” “But since the US turned off the ‘lighthouse,’ we have now entered a dark forest,” they wrote, referring to US blocks on selling advanced chip-making equipment to China

    The writers say China’s research and development investments in the sector represent less than 5% of US investments while China still lacks a proper institution to organize the industry’s developments

    Some Chinese IT writers and observers said they were surprised to read the CAS article’s dismal portrayal of China’s chip sector, which many said they didn’t think was so laggard

    So far China can still import DUV lithography machinery to make 28nm chips

    In October, it announced a new raft of chip export bans to block China from getting high-end chips and chip-making tools from the US

    ['china', 'research', 'chip', 'say', 'make']

  • BMW MOTORRAD R18 "IRON ANNIE" INSPIRED BY JU 52 - PAULTAN.ORG

    https://paultan.org/2023/02/21/bmw-motorrad-r18-iron-annie-inspired-by-ju-52/

    02/21/2023

    57.14% Shortened!

    Today, Iron Annie carries the registration D-AQUI and the name “Berlin-Tempelhof”, and is property of the German Lufthansa Berlin Foundation, clad in the pre-war Lufthansa colour scheme of grey-black from 1936 with plans to reassemble it for display

    For the R18 Iron Annie, VTR Motorrad from Schmerikon, Switzerland, took an BMW Motorrad R18 First Edition (RM149,500 in Malaysia) and incorporated aviation design cues from the Ju 52

    Aluminium bodywork was fabricated for Iron Annie, replicating the corrugated aluminium skin used on the Ju 52

    “One of the big challenges with the R18 Iron Annie was the replica cooling fins in the area of the rear silencers

    Kineo wheels measuring 21-inches in front and 18-inches at the rear were also installed, giving Iron Annie a crouched stance

    On the fuel tank, a vintage flip style fuel filler cap is found while a custom headlight fairing with rivet accents and brown saddle type seat custom made from Yves Knobel Saddlery completes the look of the R18 Iron Annie

    ['motorrad', 'february', 'custom', 'vtr', 'r18']

    Today, Iron Annie carries the registration D-AQUI and the name “Berlin-Tempelhof”, and is property of the German Lufthansa Berlin Foundation, clad in the pre-war Lufthansa colour scheme of grey-black from 1936 with plans to reassemble it for display

    For the R18 Iron Annie, VTR Motorrad from Schmerikon, Switzerland, took an BMW Motorrad R18 First Edition (RM149,500 in Malaysia) and incorporated aviation design cues from the Ju 52

    Aluminium bodywork was fabricated for Iron Annie, replicating the corrugated aluminium skin used on the Ju 52

    “One of the big challenges with the R18 Iron Annie was the replica cooling fins in the area of the rear silencers

    Kineo wheels measuring 21-inches in front and 18-inches at the rear were also installed, giving Iron Annie a crouched stance

    On the fuel tank, a vintage flip style fuel filler cap is found while a custom headlight fairing with rivet accents and brown saddle type seat custom made from Yves Knobel Saddlery completes the look of the R18 Iron Annie

    Only 0.8 per cent of those polled from his cohort were involuntarily in part-time or temporary employment within six months after their final exams

    This was down from 3.0 per cent for the 2021 cohort

    The proportion of those in involuntary part-time employment has also been dropping, he noted, saying that the numbers have been “soaked up by full-time employment”

  • DRB-HICOM ENDS FY2022 ON HIGH NOTE DESPITE 4Q LOSS OF RM100M

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/node/656163

    02/21/2023

    71.43% Shortened!

    The last time the group sank into the red was 1QFY2022, with a net loss of RM25.74 million and a revenue of RM3.07 billion.  For 4QFY2022, DRB-Hicom posted a loss per share of 5.18 sen, versus earnings per share of 6.08 sen a year ago

    Quarterly revenue, however, increased 5.42% year-on-year (y-o-y) to RM4.35 billion, from RM4.12 billion previously

    Despite losses in the postal division and properties division, it achieved an annual net profit of RM187.71 million, against an annual loss of RM296.42 million for FY2021

    Annual revenue rose 25.32% to RM15.51 billion from RM12.38 billion, lifted by contributions from almost all its business segments, except for the postal division

    Three sectors led the sterling 25.32% revenue growth in FY2022, with the automotive sector recording the highest revenue increase of RM2.89 billion to RM11.09 billion, from RM8.20 billion for FY2021

    “The rise in automotive demand driven by the government’s sales tax holiday boosted revenue for Proton and other marques under the DRB-Hicom umbrella, sending revenue rising more than 35.2%

    ['loss', 'million', 'group', 'revenue', 'billion']

    The last time the group sank into the red was 1QFY2022, with a net loss of RM25.74 million and a revenue of RM3.07 billion.  For 4QFY2022, DRB-Hicom posted a loss per share of 5.18 sen, versus earnings per share of 6.08 sen a year ago

    Quarterly revenue, however, increased 5.42% year-on-year (y-o-y) to RM4.35 billion, from RM4.12 billion previously

    Despite losses in the postal division and properties division, it achieved an annual net profit of RM187.71 million, against an annual loss of RM296.42 million for FY2021

    Annual revenue rose 25.32% to RM15.51 billion from RM12.38 billion, lifted by contributions from almost all its business segments, except for the postal division

    Three sectors led the sterling 25.32% revenue growth in FY2022, with the automotive sector recording the highest revenue increase of RM2.89 billion to RM11.09 billion, from RM8.20 billion for FY2021

    “The rise in automotive demand driven by the government’s sales tax holiday boosted revenue for Proton and other marques under the DRB-Hicom umbrella, sending revenue rising more than 35.2%

  • TECH LAYOFFS CAUSE HAVOC FOR INDIAN WORKERS IN THE UNITED STATES

    Under the terms of their visas, workers who are laid off face the prospect of having to leave the country in 60 days unless they can find another job or manage to change their immigration status

    He said people looking for help are often in a state of panic as they face a frantic search for a new job against a ticking clock

    In contrast to H-1B holders, who can seek a job with another company if they are laid off, people on L-1 visas represent intracompany transfers to the United States

    But you don’t really have an equal right to protest because then your visa is in a very risky situation.” Lacking options Even immigrants who have survived the recent wave of layoffs can be affected if their job status or salary is downgraded as part of corporate cost-cutting, labour specialists say

    A pay cut or demotion within the same company can be enough to jeopardize the status of foreign workers’ green card applications, advocates say

    “A lot of the income that I or anyone creates as an immigrant from their job ..

  • UNIFI MOBILE ULTIMATE PLAN WILL NO LONGER PROVIDE 5G THIS MARCH

    https://www.lowyat.net/2023/294611/unifi-mobile-ultimate-plan-5g-nomore/

    02/21/2023

    45.45% Shortened!

    Those who were on the postpaid track are able to connect to 5G by obtaining the unlimited 5G pass under the Ultimate Plan although this will soon come to an end

    As you may be able to recall, the telco has recently revamped its postpaid offering with the brand-new UNI5G Postpaid Plans

    The FAQ document for these plans [pdf] noted that with the launch of these new postpaid options, TM has decided to discontinue the existing 4G-only Unifi Postpaid plans

    At that time, we thought that only applies to the four postpaid plans which were known as the Value Plans

    This is because the current unlimited 5G pass for the Ultimate plan is only valid until the end of February 2023

    For those who want to obtain the same service level as per Ultimate plan which has unlimited data and calls as well as 10GB of hotspot data, they have to sign up for the UNI5G 89 plan

    ['unifi', 'customer', 'postpaid', 'ultimate', 'plan']

  • BUMPY ROAD AHEAD AS EXPORTS DISAPPOINT

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/21/bumpy-road-aheadas-exports-disappoint

    02/21/2023

    86.36% Shortened!

    Amid global recession fears, the country’s trade, exports and imports have also shrunk in Jan 2023 on a month-on-month (m-o-m) basis, even though all three categories registered the highest monthly value for the month of January

    “It is not possible to repeat 2022’s robust trade performance this year

    Our imports in January also grew well below the market prediction and this is the second consecutive month whereby our imports have contracted month-on-month

    However, on a month-on-month basis, the country’s trade, exports, imports and trade surplus in Jan 2023 contracted by 11.8%, 14.4%, 8.6% and 35.5% respectively as compared to Dec 2022

    Trade with Asean contributed 26.6% to Malaysia’s total trade, rising by 5.6% y-o-y to RM55.26bil

    It is noteworthy, however, exports to Singapore, China and the United States - Malaysia’s top three export markets - saw double-digit contraction month-on-month

    ['trade', 'jan', 'export', 'year', 'month']

    “It is not possible to repeat 2022’s robust trade performance this year

    Our imports in January also grew well below the market prediction and this is the second consecutive month whereby our imports have contracted month-on-month

    However, on a month-on-month basis, the country’s trade, exports, imports and trade surplus in Jan 2023 contracted by 11.8%, 14.4%, 8.6% and 35.5% respectively as compared to Dec 2022

    Trade with Asean contributed 26.6% to Malaysia’s total trade, rising by 5.6% y-o-y to RM55.26bil

  • POS MALAYSIA, DNEX, MBM RESOURCES, GUH AND SUNVIEW

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/node/656030

    02/21/2023

    71.43% Shortened!

    However, revenue for 4QFY2022 declined 11.61% to RM467.2 million from RM528.59 million, due to lower revenue contribution from the postal segment

    Dagang NeXchange Bhd’s (DNex) net profit for the second quarter ended Dec 31, 2022 (2QFY2023) fell by 27.3% to RM31.88 million from RM43.83 million a year earlier, partly due to higher tax expenses

    Quarterly revenue slipped 6.45% to RM330.53 million compared with RM353.31 million a year ago, due to a 25.8% weaker contribution from its technology (semiconductor fabrication) segment, on the back of lower wafer shipments

    MBM Resources Bhd’s net profit for the fourth quarter ended Dec 31, 2022 (4QFY2022) fell by 49% to RM57.41 million from RM112.81 million a year ago due to higher operating costs and lower contributions from associates

    However, quarterly revenue increased by 16.5% to RM651.4 million from RM558.92 million in 4QFY2021, thanks to higher revenue from both its motor trading and auto parts manufacturing divisions

    The three other partners Warrants RE Assets Sdn Bhd will control a 29% stake, Intechcity Construction Sdn Bhd a 31% stake and Pasir Lembayung Sdn Bhd a 20% stake

    ['high', 'guh', 'bhd', 'million', 'revenue']

    Quarterly revenue slipped 6.45% to RM330.53 million compared with RM353.31 million a year ago, due to a 25.8% weaker contribution from its technology (semiconductor fabrication) segment, on the back of lower wafer shipments

    MBM Resources Bhd’s net profit for the fourth quarter ended Dec 31, 2022 (4QFY2022) fell by 49% to RM57.41 million from RM112.81 million a year ago due to higher operating costs and lower contributions from associates

    However, quarterly revenue increased by 16.5% to RM651.4 million from RM558.92 million in 4QFY2021, thanks to higher revenue from both its motor trading and auto parts manufacturing divisions

    The three other partners Warrants RE Assets Sdn Bhd will control a 29% stake, Intechcity Construction Sdn Bhd a 31% stake and Pasir Lembayung Sdn Bhd a 20% stake

    "Taiwan and the United States continue to bolster military exchanges, and going forward Taiwan will cooperate even more actively with the United States and other democratic partners to confront such global challenges as authoritarian expansionism and climate change," Tsai told the lawmakers at her office in Taipei

    "How we can continue to build the economic partnership on technology and also of course the partnership on military and defence," Khanna added

    “When (Russian President Vladimir) Putin launched his invasion nearly one year ago, he thought Ukraine was weak and the West was divided

    “The cost that Ukraine has had to pay is extraordinarily high

    Russia says it has annexed nearly a fifth of Ukraine, while the West has pledged tens of billions of dollars in military aid to Kyiv

    Russia was notified before Biden’s departure, officials in Washington and Moscow said, apparently to avoid the risk of an attack on Kyiv while he was there

    Putin will update Russia’s political and military elite on the Ukraine conflict, the biggest confrontation with the West since the depths of the Cold War, in a speech to members of both houses of parliament on Tuesday

    02/21/2023

    71.43% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise MANILA, Feb 21 — Philippine rescue teams began climbing an active volcano Tuesday in a “very risky operation” to reach the wreckage of a small plane that crashed at the weekend, officials said

    Civil aviation investigators on board a reconnaissance flight on Tuesday confirmed that wreckage spotted on the volcano over the weekend was the missing plane

    Rain, clouds and the risk of an eruption have hampered efforts to reach the crash site

    They were expected to camp overnight and reach the crash site Wednesday, said Carlos Baldo, mayor of Camalig municipality, which overlaps the crash site

    “It’s a very risky operation,” Bacolcol told AFP

    That plane’s wreckage has still not been found, Apolonio said

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/singapore/2023/02/21/singapores-internal-security-department-detains-self-radicalised-15-year-old-deemed-an-imminent-security-threat/56099

    02/21/2023

    77.78% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise SINGAPORE, Feb 21 — A 15-year-old self-radicalised student who has been detained by law last December was assessed by the Internal Security Department (ISD) to be posing an imminent security threat that warranted preventive detention

    Another teenager, a self-radicalised 16-year-old who was caught in January, did not have intentions to conduct armed violence in Singapore or overseas and was therefore placed under a Restriction Order and not detained under the Internal Security Act (ISA)

    ISD said that the 15-year-old was willing to undertake armed violence either in Singapore or overseas to establish an Islamic caliphate

    On the other hand, the 16-year-old did not intend or plan to conduct armed violence here or abroad

    We take steps when you start planning.” Whole-of-society endeavour On how to tackle extremist influence in the video gaming sphere, ISD told TODAY that it is a “whole-of-society endeavour”

    ISD added that the public has a part to play — by being sensitised to the dangers of extremist ideas and not watching or disseminating extremist content, regardless of the channel or online site

    ['singapore', 'year', 'old', 'detain', 'isd']

    About Us Advertise SINGAPORE, Feb 21 — A 15-year-old self-radicalised student who has been detained by law last December was assessed by the Internal Security Department (ISD) to be posing an imminent security threat that warranted preventive detention

    Another teenager, a self-radicalised 16-year-old who was caught in January, did not have intentions to conduct armed violence in Singapore or overseas and was therefore placed under a Restriction Order and not detained under the Internal Security Act (ISA)

    ISD said that the 15-year-old was willing to undertake armed violence either in Singapore or overseas to establish an Islamic caliphate

    On the other hand, the 16-year-old did not intend or plan to conduct armed violence here or abroad

    We take steps when you start planning.” Whole-of-society endeavour On how to tackle extremist influence in the video gaming sphere, ISD told TODAY that it is a “whole-of-society endeavour”

    ISD added that the public has a part to play — by being sensitised to the dangers of extremist ideas and not watching or disseminating extremist content, regardless of the channel or online site

    ['singapore', 'year', 'old', 'detain', 'isd']



  • PUTIN DELIVERS A NUCLEAR WARNING TO THE WEST OVER UKRAINE

    https://www.malaysiakini.com/world/655928

    02/21/2023

    82.86% Shortened!

    Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday delivered a nuclear warning to the West over Ukraine, suspending a landmark nuclear arms control treaty, announcing new strategic systems had been put on combat duty, and warning that Moscow could resume nuclear tests

    Cautioning the United States that it was stoking the war into a global conflict, Putin said that Russia was suspending participation in the New Start Treaty, the last major arms control treaty between Moscow and Washington

    Russia's defence ministry and nuclear corporation should therefore be ready to test Russian nuclear weapons if necessary, he said

    Putin said Ukraine had sought to strike a facility deep inside Russia where some of its nuclear bombers are based, a reference to the Engels air base

    Russia and the United States have vast arsenals of nuclear weapons left over from the Cold War and remain, by far, the biggest nuclear powers

    More war Besides the promise to continue the war and warnings to the West of a global confrontation, Putin also sought to justify the war, saying it had been forced on Russia and that he understood the pain of the families of those who had fallen in battle

    ['putin', 'nuclear', 'ukraine', 'say', 'russia']

    Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday delivered a nuclear warning to the West over Ukraine, suspending a landmark nuclear arms control treaty, announcing new strategic systems had been put on combat duty, and warning that Moscow could resume nuclear tests

    Cautioning the United States that it was stoking the war into a global conflict, Putin said that Russia was suspending participation in the New Start Treaty, the last major arms control treaty between Moscow and Washington

    Russia's defence ministry and nuclear corporation should therefore be ready to test Russian nuclear weapons if necessary, he said

    Putin said Ukraine had sought to strike a facility deep inside Russia where some of its nuclear bombers are based, a reference to the Engels air base

    Russia and the United States have vast arsenals of nuclear weapons left over from the Cold War and remain, by far, the biggest nuclear powers

    More war Besides the promise to continue the war and warnings to the West of a global confrontation, Putin also sought to justify the war, saying it had been forced on Russia and that he understood the pain of the families of those who had fallen in battle

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 21 — Gerik Member of Parliament Fathul Huzir Ayob clarified that he was not sick but was overcome by emotions and shed tears when talking about the hardship of the people in his parliamentary constituency while debating in the Dewan Rakyat, yesterday

    Recapping the situation, he said he could not continue his debate because he was overwhelmed by emotions when thinking about the people of Gerik who are suffering in poverty and are left behind while the area was rich in natural resources

    “The poor people whom I met came to mind

    I am not sick at all

    Fathul added that yesterday he had actually wanted to put forward the rights of people in rural areas who have natural resources and contribute to the country’s income like Gerik be protected and restored

    He who likened the people of Gerik to ‘living in a world of plenty yet dying of hunger’ suggested that the Ministry of Finance set up a corporation and foundation to look into the development of projects in Hulu Perak by involving the local community

    ['gerik', 'fathul', 'people', 'debate', 'dewan']

    Anwar was replying to a question by Azli Yusof (PH-Shah Alam) on whether the government intends to proceed with the development of Kampung Baru in line with the target of Kuala Lumpur Smart City 2030

    The Prime Minister said on the question of Kampung Baru’s development, each approach or move must be based on the principle of safeguarding the interests of the Malay reserve areas in Kuala Lumpur, even though the decision took a long time

    Replying to a supplementary question by Datuk Seri Dr Ismail Abd Muttalib (PN-Maran) regarding the government’s guarantee of implementing promises related to the development of Kampung Baru, Anwar insisted that there are actions that have been implemented and it is not just a guarantee (words)

    The former finance minister said he was called for questioning yesterday as a witness into the Jana Wibawa project that was introduced by the federal government when Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin was prime minister

    “I would like to confirm that I have testified as a witness to assist the investigation of the Jana Wibawa Empowerment of Bumiputera Contractors Program (Jana Wibawa) by MACC late afternoon yesterday

    However, Deputy Prime Minister I Datuk Seri Ahmad Zahid Hamidi announced on February 15 that the government now led by Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim as prime minister will postpone the RM5.7 billion worth of rural development projects under the Jana Wibawa scheme

    Two Bersatu officials were today charged in the Sessions Court with bribery in relation to the Jana Wibawa scheme

    They are Bersatu information chief Wan Saiful Wan Jan who is also first-term Tasek Gelugor MP, and Segambut Bersatu division deputy chief Adam Radlan Adam Muhammad

    The MACC has also questioned Muhyiddin.

    ['minister', 'datuk', 'seri', 'macc', 'jana']

    The former finance minister said he was called for questioning yesterday as a witness into the Jana Wibawa project that was introduced by the federal government when Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin was prime minister

    “I would like to confirm that I have testified as a witness to assist the investigation of the Jana Wibawa Empowerment of Bumiputera Contractors Program (Jana Wibawa) by MACC late afternoon yesterday

    However, Deputy Prime Minister I Datuk Seri Ahmad Zahid Hamidi announced on February 15 that the government now led by Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim as prime minister will postpone the RM5.7 billion worth of rural development projects under the Jana Wibawa scheme

    Two Bersatu officials were today charged in the Sessions Court with bribery in relation to the Jana Wibawa scheme

    They are Bersatu information chief Wan Saiful Wan Jan who is also first-term Tasek Gelugor MP, and Segambut Bersatu division deputy chief Adam Radlan Adam Muhammad

    The MACC has also questioned Muhyiddin.

    ['minister', 'datuk', 'seri', 'macc', 'jana']

  • COST OF HIRING INDONESIAN DOMESTIC WORKERS TO BE REVIEWED, SAYS HR MINISTER

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/20/cost-of-hiring-indonesian-domestic-workers-to-be-reviewed-says-hr-minister

    02/20/2023, 23:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    Monday, 20 Feb 2023

    The Human Resources Minister said the reduction in the cost of recruitment would be discussed at the two-day Joint Working Group Meeting in Yogjakarta beginning Wednesday (Feb 22)

    Sivakumar said he hoped the cost could be brought down to under RM9,000 compared to the RM12,000 decided in the last meeting in November 2022, inclusive of the quarantine cost of RM3,000

    "To have zero cost is impossible because there are costs involved including in Malaysia, but we look at what is the best mechanism to reduce the cost,” he told the Malaysian media after holding a meeting with his Indonesian counterpart, Dr Ida Fauziyah on Monday (Feb 20)

    He and Ida Fauziyah also discussed efforts to realise the implementation of the "Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) on the Recruitment and Protection of Indonesian Domestic Workers in Malaysia" that was signed on April 1, 2022

    Of the total, 63,323 work as domestic workers, and Indonesians represent the largest number in the sector in Malaysia

    ['malaysia', 'cost', 'domestic', 'indonesian', 'worker']

    https://fortune.com/2023/02/20/qatari-sheikh-jassim-bin-hamad-bid-manchester-united-6-billion-biggest-sports-buyout/

    02/20/2023, 21:10

    79.31% Shortened!

    Sheikh Jassim Bin Hamad J.J

    Sheikh Jassim, backed by almost unlimited wealth, could post a final offer that values Manchester United, currently owned by the Glazer family, at about £5 billion ($6 billion), Bloomberg News has reported

    Sheikh Jassim’s family has been involved in major sports deals in the past — HBJ was prime minister in 2010 when Qatar won its controversial bid to host the 2022 World Cup.  Sheikh Jassim will now have to navigate another family deal

    The US-based Glazer family — led by Avram Glazer and Joel Glazer, executive co-chairmen and directors of Manchester United — have been considering their investment in the club since last year

    Sheikh Jassim will have to convince both Europe’s footballing organizer UEFA that the source of his wealth is not linked to Paris St

    Qatar has been keen to state that QSI is not a subsidiary of QIA, currently the largest shareholder of the Qatar Islamic Bank, where Sheikh Jassim is chairman.  If he succeeds, Sheikh Jassim will be sure to find rivals wherever he turns

    ['sheikh', 'jassim', 'manchester', 'united', 'qatar']

    Erik ten Hag has continued to put his faith in Wout Weghorst despite a slow scoring start to life at Man Utd

    Weghorst has arrived at United at a difficult time given he will naturally draw comparisons with Anthony Martial and Cristiano Ronaldo, and while he has not matched the duo for goals this season, he has at least given Ten Hag the reliable work rate he demands up front

    I think he is doing a very good job in this moment in several aspects of the football." This was the case again against Leicester at the weekend, with Weghorst playing a key role in United's approach, even though he didn't enjoy the best day in front of goal himself

    It is also important to note that it is not Weghorst's fault that he has been exposed by the lack of options in the United squad

    Ten Hag is the man paid to make the decisions at United, and the fact he continues to trust his compatriot up front speaks volumes of the value he brings to the team

    Weghorst might not be the striker United fans wanted, but right now he is the striker they need

  • US PRESIDENT BIDEN PLEDGES MILITARY AID DURING UNANNOUNCED KYIV VISIT

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2023/02/20/us-president-biden-pledges-military-aid-during-unannounced-kyiv-visit/55891

    02/20/2023, 20:08

    41.67% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KYIV, Feb 20 — US President Joe Biden announced new military aid for Ukraine during an unannounced visit to the Ukrainian capital today, showing solidarity with Kyiv days before the first anniversary of Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine

    Air raid sirens blared across the Ukrainian capital as Biden visited Kyiv for talks with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, but there were no reports of Russian missile or air strikes

    Biden said Washington would stand with Ukraine as long as it takes

    Biden said Washington would provide Kyiv with a new military aid package worth US$500 million (RM2.2 billion) that would be announced tomorrow

    In a speech, Biden commended Ukraine’s courage during the war and noted that he had visited Kyiv six times when he had earlier served as vice president

    “I knew I would be back,” he said

    Ukraine is preparing for what it expects to be a major new Russian offensive that some military analysts say is already under way

    ['kyiv', 'president', 'biden', 'military', 'ukraine']

  • PAN GON IS A HAPPY MAN IN MALAYSIA, EXCEPT FOR THE PRESSURE

    https://www.thesundaily.my/sport/pan-gon-is-a-happy-man-in-malaysia-except-for-the-pressure-PB10661428

    02/20/2023, 20:08

    45.45% Shortened!

    The 52-year-old South Korean, who began his duty almost a year ago, said he liked the country as the people are generally kind, the weather is good and the environment is peaceful, apart from his relish for local food

    “Last week was exactly one year since my first press conference here

    It was an amazing journey, though when I first arrived, the (2020) AFF Cup results (played from Dec 2021-Jan 2022) was not good, a lot of pressure

    Pan Gon said, most importantly, his coaching team had instilled a clear direction for the Harimau Malaya squad, to have own Malaysian football-DNA, and play dominating and dynamic football

    End of this year, we will be in a different phase - the Asian Cup and World Cup qualifications - both are tough tournaments, so we request patience from fans and continuous support,” he added

    Since taking charge of the Harimau Malaya squad, Pan Gon has guided them to qualify for the Asian Cup in June last year, on merit for a first time in 42 years, besides advancing to the semi-finals of the 2022 AFF Cup, despite the absence of top players

    ['year', 'since', 'coach', 'pan', 'gon']

    The 52-year-old South Korean, who began his duty almost a year ago, said he liked the country as the people are generally kind, the weather is good and the environment is peaceful, apart from his relish for local food

    “Last week was exactly one year since my first press conference here

    It was an amazing journey, though when I first arrived, the (2020) AFF Cup results (played from Dec 2021-Jan 2022) was not good, a lot of pressure

    Pan Gon said, most importantly, his coaching team had instilled a clear direction for the Harimau Malaya squad, to have own Malaysian football-DNA, and play dominating and dynamic football

    End of this year, we will be in a different phase - the Asian Cup and World Cup qualifications - both are tough tournaments, so we request patience from fans and continuous support,” he added

    Since taking charge of the Harimau Malaya squad, Pan Gon has guided them to qualify for the Asian Cup in June last year, on merit for a first time in 42 years, besides advancing to the semi-finals of the 2022 AFF Cup, despite the absence of top players

  • APPEALS COURT SETS AUG 11 TO HEAR NAJIB'S APPEAL OVER BID TO ATTEND PARLIAMENT SITTINGS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/20/appeals-court-sets-aug-11-to-hear-najib039s-appeal-over-bid-to-attend-parliament-sittings

    02/20/2023, 19:09

    60.0% Shortened!

    Monday, 20 Feb 2023

    A case management for the appeal was conducted on Monday before Court of Appeal deputy registrar Norshakinah Ahmad Kamarudin

    On Oct 27, last year, the High Court in Kuala Lumpur dismissed the former prime minister's application to obtain leave to commence a judicial review to challenge the Prisons Department's refusal to allow his request to attend Parliament sittings

    Judge Datuk Ahmad Kamal Md Shahid held that Najib's application was academic as he ceased to be a MP following the dissolution of Parliament on Oct 10 last year, which had paved the way for the 15th General Election which was subsequently held on Nov 19 last year

    Najib had named the Malaysian Government, the Minister of Home Affairs and the Commissioner-General of Prisons in his application seeking leave to initiate a judicial review which he filed on Oct 5, last year

    The hearing of his application to review the Federal Court's decision is currently ongoing

    ['court', 'appeal', 'najib', 'prison', 'parliament']

    The new deal will see his salary adjusted according to his new status in Erik ten Hag's squad due to the progress he has made since making his first team debut last April

    Negotiations over new terms started a few months ago and a source close to the talks confirmed to ESPN the club and the player have now reached an agreement over the financial elements of the deal and the length of the contract

    Garnacho, who joined United from Atletico Madrid in 2020, has a Spanish father and an Argentine mother and is eligible to play for both countries

    ESPN'S Rob Dawson contributed to this report.

  • POS MALAYSIA NET LOSS NARROWS IN 4Q

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/20/pos-malaysia-net-loss-narrows-in-4q

    02/20/2023, 18:10

    57.14% Shortened!

    “We remain fully focused on our transformation plan and despite the challenges, we remain cautiously optimistic that the group will deliver improved results in 2023,” group chief executive officer Charles Brewer said in a statement

    “In the fourth quarter, Pos Malaysia continued to make solid progress with the transformation plan that we embarked on in August 2021

    The postal and parcel service provider’s revenue stood at RM467.2mil in the fourth quarter against RM528.6mil a year earlier

    Its loss per share for the quarter stood at 12.57 sen from 15.74 sen last year

    For the full financial year ended Dec 31, 2022 (FY22), Pos Malaysia posted a net loss of RM167.7mil compared with a net loss of RM335.7mil for the corresponding period in 2021

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['po', 'malaysia', 'loss', 'quarter', 'group']

  • CYCLONE GABRIELLE RECOVERY EXPECTED TO COST NEW ZEALAND BILLIONS

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/world/cyclone-gabrielle-new-zealand-recovery-expected-cost-billions-3290951

    02/20/2023

    70.0% Shortened!

    Prime Minister Chris Hipkins confirmed that 11 people had so far died in the wake of the devastating flash flooding and high winds which lashed the North Island last week

    Hipkins has warned that the final death toll could rise, but the number of people who police were still looking to contact had fallen to about 2,300

    Finance Minister Grant Robertson on Monday pledged NZ$300 million (US$187 million) of relief

    "We have a long job ahead of us to rebuild after this disaster," warned Robertson, who Hipkins has also made cyclone recovery minister

    After spending the weekend visiting hard-hit communities, Hipkins said that the national state of emergency declared last week has been extended by another seven days

    This is only the third time in New Zealand's 183-year history that a national state of emergency has been declared

    ['new', 'zealand', 'cyclone', 'emergency', 'hipkins']

    Siti Bainun, 31, told the court that she had appointed Mohammad Farhan Maaruf to represent her in the defence trial

    Mohammad Farhan, when confirming the matter, said he was re-appointed by Siti Bainun yesterday

    Subsequently, deputy public prosecutor Zilfinaz Abbas requested the court to record the chronology of the withdrawal of the lawyers representing Siti Bainun in the case

    Following the withdrawal of the five lawyers, Siti Bainun was left with no legal representation in court

    Last Jan 26, Judge Izralizam ordered Siti Bainun to enter her defence on the charges even though she had no legal representation, saying that the proceedings should continue so as not to disrupt the progress of the case

    On Nov 24 last year, the court ordered Siti Bainun to enter her defence on the charges of neglecting and abusing Bella after the prosecution succeeded in establishing a prima facie case against her at the end of the prosecution case

  • SRC CONVICTION REVIEW: FEDERAL COURT COMMITTED FUNDAMENTAL ERROR AFTER ENFORCING ‘FORCED REPRESENTATION’ OF INEFFECTIVE COUNSEL, SAYS SHAFEE

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/20/src-conviction-review-federal-court-committed-fundamental-error-after-enforcing-forced-representation-of-ineffective-counsel-says-shafee/55833

    02/20/2023, 17:09

    66.67% Shortened!

    Telling the Federal Court during the former prime minister’s bid to have his SRC International conviction and sentence reviewed, Tan Sri Muhammad Shafee Abdullah said then counsel Hisyam Teh Poh Teik was not accorded reasonable opportunity to present his case in August 2022

    Muhammad Shafee said despite the defence’s insistence in August back then, the Federal Court’s five-judge panel led by Chief Justice Tun Tengku Maimun Tuan Mat unanimously dismissed the defence’s bid for a postponement to be granted

    It was a representation by ‘pretence’, supervised by the Federal Court

    A five-member panel presided over today’s hearing with Chief Judge of Sabah and Sarawak Datuk Abdul Rahman Sebli leading; Federal Court judges Datuk Vernon Ong Lam Kiat, Datuk Rhodzariah Bujang, Datuk Nordin Hassan and Court of Appeal judge Datuk Abu Bakar Jais on the bench

    Following his incarceration, Najib had since sought to challenge the Federal Court’s five-member bench’s August 2022 unanimous decision in affirming his conviction, sentence and fine meted out by the High Court for the misappropriation of RM42 million of SRC International Sdn Bhd fund

    Mohd Nazlan, who is now a Court of Appeal judge, had sentenced Najib to 12 years in jail and fined him RM210 million in default five years imprisonment and his decision was upheld by the Court of Appeal on Dec 8, 2021

    ['federal', 'court', 'datuk', 'muhammad', 'shafee']

    Muhammad Shafee said despite the defence’s insistence in August back then, the Federal Court’s five-judge panel led by Chief Justice Tun Tengku Maimun Tuan Mat unanimously dismissed the defence’s bid for a postponement to be granted

    It was a representation by ‘pretence’, supervised by the Federal Court

    Frankly, car reviews only provide you with a general impression of the car, from the reviewer’s perspective

    You’re spending the money and you’ll be living with the car you buy

    Honda HRV full of plastics, Toyota Corolla Cross with foot pedal brake

  • HANNAH YEOH: MAKE MALAYSIAN MOTORSPORTS AFFORDABLE - PAULTAN.ORG

    https://paultan.org/2023/02/20/hannah-yeoh-make-malaysian-motorsports-affordable/

    02/20/2023, 16:08

    75.0% Shortened!

    During her welcome speech at the 30 Years of Malaysian Cub Prix dinner, Yeoh said finances is an issue in Malaysian motorsport

    “How can we make this (motorsports) more affordable?” asks Yeoh

    Yeoh said she wants to co-ordinate amongst government ministries and agencies to remove “roadblocks” that stand in the way of productive investment in motorsports and “money should not be pumped in to solving bureaucracy.” “How do we make it affordable? By removing roadblocks,” Yeoh says

    “What kind of model can we put together to ensure we have more infrastructure but is not dependant on government for maintenance,” added Yeoh

    Yeoh also called on organisers to make motorsports inspiring for young people

    “In order to inspire young people you have to give them more platforms to race safely,” Yeoh said

    ['malaysian', 'february', 'motorsports', 'say', 'yeoh']

  • SHAFEE ARGUES FED COURT MADE FUNDAMENTAL ERROR IN LAW BY NOT ALLOWING SRC TRIAL TO ADJOURN

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/node/655930

    02/20/2023, 16:08

    80.65% Shortened!

    Hisyam said he had not read the papers from the Court of Appeal

    It is a fundamental error by the apex court to allow the counsel to remain behind on board representing Najib

    Hisyam remains in court but this court should consider that he (Hisyam) was not in any effect to represent Najib (at that point),” he said, adding that Hisyam could not effectively represent the former PM

    Shafee said the court should treat Najib as not being represented at the Federal Court hearing last August

    “In the face of no representation by counsel, as Hisyam was just there at the direction of the court not as a counsel

    Hence, in this case the apex court should grant a [review] under Rule 137 of the Federal Court Rules

  • DNEX EXPECTS WAFER DELIVERY VOLUMES TO NORMALISE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/20/dnex-expects-wafer-delivery-volumes-to-normalise

    02/20/2023

    64.71% Shortened!

    In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the technology group said concerns over a global economic downturn have led to inventory adjustments and short-term fluctuations in demand for semiconductors

    "Wafer shipment volume has been impacted as customers have reduced their orders in response to projected demand," it said

    The drop in wafer shipments impacted the group's revenue for the quarter ended Dec 31, 2022, which fell 6.4% year-on-year (y-o-y) to RM330.53mil

    In the technology segment alone, revenue contribution declined 25.8% y-o-y, although the impact of the decline was mitigated by revenue increases in the energy and IT segments of 36.3% and 9.3% respectively

    Short-term demand volatility notwithstanding, Dnex projects a strong future outlook for semiconductor chips with the persistent adoption of electric vehicles, Internet of Things devices and 5G technology

    The semiconductor manufacturing group added that its 60%-owned wafer foundry SilTerra Malaysia Sdn Bhd has been able to gradually increase its volume of emerging technologies such as microelectromechanical systems (MEMS) and Silicon Photonics, leading to higher average selling prices (ASP) recorded

    ['dnex', 'volume', 'wafer', 'term', 'technology']

    In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the technology group said concerns over a global economic downturn have led to inventory adjustments and short-term fluctuations in demand for semiconductors

    "Wafer shipment volume has been impacted as customers have reduced their orders in response to projected demand," it said

    The drop in wafer shipments impacted the group's revenue for the quarter ended Dec 31, 2022, which fell 6.4% year-on-year (y-o-y) to RM330.53mil

    In the technology segment alone, revenue contribution declined 25.8% y-o-y, although the impact of the decline was mitigated by revenue increases in the energy and IT segments of 36.3% and 9.3% respectively

    Short-term demand volatility notwithstanding, Dnex projects a strong future outlook for semiconductor chips with the persistent adoption of electric vehicles, Internet of Things devices and 5G technology

    The semiconductor manufacturing group added that its 60%-owned wafer foundry SilTerra Malaysia Sdn Bhd has been able to gradually increase its volume of emerging technologies such as microelectromechanical systems (MEMS) and Silicon Photonics, leading to higher average selling prices (ASP) recorded

    ['dnex', 'volume', 'wafer', 'term', 'technology']

  • LEE: M'SIAN CARS CROSSING OVER TO BRUNEI, KALIMANTAN STILL REQUIRED TO DISPLAY ROAD TAX

    https://www.theborneopost.com/2023/02/20/lee-msian-cars-crossing-over-to-brunei-kalimantan-still-required-to-display-road-tax/

    02/20/2023, 15:08

    50.0% Shortened!

    “Both Brunei Darussalam and Indonesia are maintaining the usual procedure, where physical road tax are required to be displayed on their vehicles and carrying physical driving licence when entering Brunei Darussalam and Indonesia,” he said in the statement issued today

    Lee said his ministry will work closely with the Consul General Office of Brunei Darussalam and Consul General Office of Indonesia in Kuching on the issue

    On Feb 10, federal Transport Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook announced that the ministry and Road Transport Department (JPJ) would no longer need drivers to carry around a physical copy of their driving licence

    Loke also said drivers do not need to have the road tax displayed on their vehicle windscreen

    Before the announcement, this was a requirement under Section 20 of the Road Transport Act 1987 (Act 333)

    “The Minister for Transport Malaysia reiterated that drivers can still obtain a physical copy of their road tax from JPJ offices or the post office and stick it onto their cars as well as carry around physical driving licence for now,” added Lee.

    ['say', 'driver', 'transport', 'jpj', 'vehicle']

    “Both Brunei Darussalam and Indonesia are maintaining the usual procedure, where physical road tax are required to be displayed on their vehicles and carrying physical driving licence when entering Brunei Darussalam and Indonesia,” he said in the statement issued today

  • ISLAMIC PARTY IN MALAYSIA UNDER PROBE AFTER MEMBERS STAGE MARCH WITH FAKE SWORDS, SPEARS AND SHIELDS

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/malaysia-pas-youth-terengganu-march-fake-swords-spears-shields-cosplay-3290721

    02/20/2023, 14:09

    68.42% Shortened!

    Youth wing members of Parti Islam Se-Malaysia (PAS) clad in medieval Islamic war attire, marching with fake swords and shields in Setiu, Terengganu on Feb 17, 2023

    According to Terengganu police chief Rohaimi Md Isa, initial investigations showed that the event took place on Friday (Feb 17) at a resort in Setiu, Terengganu

    “Police will carry out an investigation to identify any offences in the programme and appropriate action will be taken,” he said in a statement on Monday.  Mr Rohaimi, however, said that the police were not informed about the march involving replicas of weapons, though they were notified of the event earlier

    “We were not informed about the march with replicas of weapons, which has caused uneasiness and concern among the public,” he said

    The march was part of a two-day PAS youth wing gathering, known as Himpunan Pemuda Islam Terengganu (HIMPIT), or Terengganu Muslim Youth Gathering.  Mr Rohaimi added that the march, which was attended by party members from various districts in the state, was part of a design competition involving the theme of clothing, weapons and Islamic heritage.  In a statement on Monday, Home Minister Saifuddin Nasution Ismail condemned the march and urged all parties to stop acts that have the potential to create chaos for the people and the country

    He also questioned the intention of the march which was uploaded to social media with an Arabic song in the background emphasising the theme of war.  “This invites the question of whether this parade meant to inject the spirit of war,” said Mr Saifuddin

    ['event', 'action', 'youth', 'pa', 'march']

    Youth wing members of Parti Islam Se-Malaysia (PAS) clad in medieval Islamic war attire, marching with fake swords and shields in Setiu, Terengganu on Feb 17, 2023

    According to Terengganu police chief Rohaimi Md Isa, initial investigations showed that the event took place on Friday (Feb 17) at a resort in Setiu, Terengganu

    “Police will carry out an investigation to identify any offences in the programme and appropriate action will be taken,” he said in a statement on Monday.  Mr Rohaimi, however, said that the police were not informed about the march involving replicas of weapons, though they were notified of the event earlier

    “We were not informed about the march with replicas of weapons, which has caused uneasiness and concern among the public,” he said

    The march was part of a two-day PAS youth wing gathering, known as Himpunan Pemuda Islam Terengganu (HIMPIT), or Terengganu Muslim Youth Gathering.  Mr Rohaimi added that the march, which was attended by party members from various districts in the state, was part of a design competition involving the theme of clothing, weapons and Islamic heritage.  In a statement on Monday, Home Minister Saifuddin Nasution Ismail condemned the march and urged all parties to stop acts that have the potential to create chaos for the people and the country

    He also questioned the intention of the march which was uploaded to social media with an Arabic song in the background emphasising the theme of war.  “This invites the question of whether this parade meant to inject the spirit of war,” said Mr Saifuddin

  • FORD MUSTANG MACH-E TO GET NEW LFP BATTERY OPTION - PAULTAN.ORG

    https://paultan.org/2023/02/20/ford-mustang-mach-e-to-get-new-lfp-battery-option/

    02/20/2023, 14:09

    60.0% Shortened!

    LFP will be a second battery chemistry option to run alongside nickel cobalt manganese (NCM)

    Other automakers have also been using this approach, offering models with both LFP and NCM battery options

    Even in Malaysia, the Ora Good Cat is another example of an electric car that offers an optional LFP battery

    The more affordable 400 Pro model uses an LFP battery while the 500 Ultra uses an NMC battery

    LFP battery is safer, cheaper, better longevity lifespan

    LFP has lesser energy density per weight

    ['car', 'february', 'lfp', 'battery', 'model']

    Other automakers have also been using this approach, offering models with both LFP and NCM battery options

    Even in Malaysia, the Ora Good Cat is another example of an electric car that offers an optional LFP battery

  • FAHMI APPOINTS FORMER MCMC CHAIRMAN AL-ISHSAL AS COMMUNICATIONS AND DIGITAL ADVISOR

    https://soyacincau.com/2023/02/20/fahmi-appoints-former-mcmc-chairman-al-ishsal-ishak-as-advisor/

    02/20/2023, 14:08

    50.0% Shortened!

    Communications and Digital Minister Fahmi Fadzil has appointed Al-Ishsal bin Dato Prof Ishak T Kechik as his Communications and Digital advisor with immediate effect

    Al-Ishsal has over 30 years of experience in various industry sectors and served as the Group CEO at Pos Malaysia Berhad before joining the MCMC

    Some of his past appointments include Chief Digital Officer at McCann Erickson Worldgroup, CEO of Baraka Telecom, Senior VP of Marketing & Products at Malaysia Airlines, Group Head of Ancillary Income of AirAsia and a trainer and consultant for Airbus Group

    He holds a Bachelor of Management (Honours) from University Sains Malaysia and was also a Japan Airlines summer scholarship beneficiary at Sophia University in Tokyo

    During his tenure at the MCMC, he oversaw the planning and deployment of the National Fiberisation and Connectivity Plan (NFCP) as well as the initial plan to rollout 5G by Q3 2020. Under the previous administration, the government intended to deploy 5G through a private-led 5G consortium which utilises existing telco resources and infrastructure to speed up deployment and prevent duplication of infrastructure

    Malaysia’s 5G Single Wholesale Network, Digital Nasional Berhad, has repeatedly warned that a second 5G network would have significant national implications as it will delay deployment and increase the cost of 5G deployment.

    ['communication', 'digital', 'ishsal', 'say', 'malaysia']

    Communications and Digital Minister Fahmi Fadzil has appointed Al-Ishsal bin Dato Prof Ishak T Kechik as his Communications and Digital advisor with immediate effect

    Al-Ishsal has over 30 years of experience in various industry sectors and served as the Group CEO at Pos Malaysia Berhad before joining the MCMC

    Some of his past appointments include Chief Digital Officer at McCann Erickson Worldgroup, CEO of Baraka Telecom, Senior VP of Marketing & Products at Malaysia Airlines, Group Head of Ancillary Income of AirAsia and a trainer and consultant for Airbus Group

    He holds a Bachelor of Management (Honours) from University Sains Malaysia and was also a Japan Airlines summer scholarship beneficiary at Sophia University in Tokyo

    During his tenure at the MCMC, he oversaw the planning and deployment of the National Fiberisation and Connectivity Plan (NFCP) as well as the initial plan to rollout 5G by Q3 2020. Under the previous administration, the government intended to deploy 5G through a private-led 5G consortium which utilises existing telco resources and infrastructure to speed up deployment and prevent duplication of infrastructure

    Malaysia’s 5G Single Wholesale Network, Digital Nasional Berhad, has repeatedly warned that a second 5G network would have significant national implications as it will delay deployment and increase the cost of 5G deployment.

    ['communication', 'digital', 'ishsal', 'say', 'malaysia']

    Sivanesan elaborate on the current and future plan for Kampar Hospital.

    He said that this is the first complaint that this hospital has received about the dress code

    He added that the Feb 12 incident has sparked a debate about the hospital's dress code

    The hospital will be sensible,” said Sivanesan

    Sivanesan said that he had heard from Kampar Hospital director Dr Khairul Azhar at a briefing that the hospital has only eight haemodialysis machines and all are fully occupied

    It is my hope that she will come and visit Kampar Hospital to see how crucial it is for us to have a new one,” said Sivanesan

  • MALAYSIA'S EXPORT VALUE EXPANDS TO RM112.84BIL IN JANUARY

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/20/malaysia039s-exports-expand-to-rm11284bil-in-january

    02/20/2023, 12:10

    71.43% Shortened!

    Miti also reported a 2.3% increase in imports to RM94.67bil, which narrowed Malaysia's trade surplus by 2.1% year-on-year (y-o-y) to RM18.16bil

    Among its major trading partners, Malaysia recorded a 5.6% y-o-y increase in total trade with Asean to RM55.26bil

    Shipments to Singapore, which is Malaysia's biggest export destination, grew 19% y-o-y to RM17.92bil

    Other leading export destinations included the US, which saw a marginal 0.6% decrease in Malaysian exports, and Japan, which received 13.2% more exports from Malaysia

    Malaysia's leading import sources China and Singapore saw a 4.9% and 4.1% decline in shipments to the country in January.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

  • GOVT LOOKING AT RIDE-SHARING PROPOSAL TO IMPROVE LAST-MILE CONNECTIVITY, SAYS LOKE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/20/govt-looking-at-ride-sharing-proposal-to-improve-last-mile-connectivity-says-loke

    02/20/2023, 12:08

    64.71% Shortened!

    Monday, 20 Feb 2023

    "One of their suggestions is ride-sharing," the Transport Minister told reporters after launching the free shuttle bus service from Kuala Lumpur Sentral to Parliament complex on Monday (Feb 20)

    Earlier this month, Loke announced that the Land Public Transport Agency (Apad) was currently looking at implementing a ride-sharing pilot project where ehailing and taxi companies offer commuter rides to the MRT stations at lower fares

    Loke said that ridership for public transport such as the MRT (mass rapid transit) could be further increased if first and last-mile issues are resolved

    In a related matter, Loke said that Prasarana Malaysia Berhad (Prasarana) will look at using smaller feeder buses aimed at improving first and last-mile connectivity

    He said this would be based on the success of the pilot project which provides a free shuttle bus service from KL Sentral and Parliament complex

    ['ehailing', 'ride', 'say', 'loke', 'transport']

  • EDUCATION MINISTER: RECORDING PROCESS FOR SPM LISTENING TEST CONDUCTED BEFORE VOICE-ACTOR TURNED TIKTOK INFLUENCER

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/20/education-minister-recording-process-for-spm-listening-test-conducted-before-voice-actor-turned-tiktok-influencer/55808

    02/20/2023, 11:39

    57.14% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise BANGI, Feb 20 — Education Minister Fadhlina Sidek today clarified that the recording process for the SPM listening test happened long before the hired voice actor became a TikTok influencer

    “Integrity is the most important issue for Examination Board and state education department, and we look into the validity and credibility of the voice actor (carefully),” said Fadhlina after visiting SPM takers during their first day of exam here at SMK Jalan Empat in Bandar Baru Bangi

    Earlier, netizens questioned the credibility of a TikToker who was allegedly hired to conduct the voice-over for the SPM English listening test that was held on February 16

    Candidates claimed to struggle during the test because the actor spoke too fast with unclear pronunciation

    “So the process has been smooth and we will monitor it from time to time,” said Fadlina when asked by reporters about the data system of the state education department

    Fadhlina, whose son is also taking the exam today, said that her family had fasted and prayed for his success

    ['education', 'fadhlina', 'process', 'spm', 'test']

  • RECOGNISING UEC NOT A PRIORITY, SAYS EDUCATION MINISTER

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/20/recognising-uec-not-a-priority-says-education-minister

    02/20/2023, 11:17

    50.0% Shortened!

    Monday, 20 Feb 2023

    The Education Minister said that to date, the ministry does not recognise the UEC which is implemented in private Chinese secondary schools (SMPC)

    "This stand is based on the National Education Policy and Education Act 1960 which has always been the view of the ministry," she said in a written reply to a question raised by Tan Sri Abdul Hadi Awang (PN-Marang) in Dewan Rakyat on Monday (Feb 20)

    In November last year, the United Chinese School Committees' Association of Malaysia (Dong Zong) repeated its call for the recognition of the UEC

    According to Dong Zong, the SMPC adheres to a curriculum, which includes history as a subject, drafted based on the ministry's standard, as well as having Bahasa Malaysia as a compulsory subject in recognition of the national language under the Federal Constitution and Rukun Negara

    On a related question by Hadi, Fadhlina said that no allocation is provided to the SMPC

    ['recognition', 'uec', 'say', 'education', 'ministry']

    Monday, 20 Feb 2023

    “United have spent an immense amount since (Sir Alex) Ferguson left (he retired in 2013 after guiding them to their last league title) and been poor, to put it mildly

    “We want a Manchester United anchored in its proud history and roots in the north-west of England, putting the Manchester back into Manchester United,” Ineos said in their statement confirming they were in the race to buy the club

    That is a far cry from the bitter cold of the North and South Poles

    “It was one of the more miserable experiences of my life,” Ratcliffe said of the 2011 trip to the South Pole

  • MORE SINGAPORE GRADUATES REMAINED UNEMPLOYED SIX MONTHS AFTER LEAVING SCHOOL IN 2022, SURVEY FINDS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/singapore/2023/02/20/more-singapore-graduates-remained-unemployed-six-months-after-leaving-school-in-2022-survey-finds/55803

    02/20/2023, 11:10

    60.0% Shortened!

    Among these, 87.5 per cent secured a full-time job, up from 84 per cent in 2021

    The proportion of those who were freelancing increased slightly to 1.8 per cent from 1.7 per cent in 2021

    The proportion of graduates in part-time or temporary employment fell to 4.5 per cent from 8.7 per cent in 2021

    The proportion in 2022 was 97.4 per cent, down from 98.1 per cent in 2021

    Of these, 94.9 per cent secured a full-time job, down from 96 per cent in 2021

    Another 0.8 per cent were freelancing, compared to 0.3 per cent in 2021

  • BUDGET 2023 LIKELY TO MAINTAIN PROPOSED TAX CUT FOR M40, TAX RISE FOR T20

    https://www.thesundaily.my/local/budget-2023-likely-to-maintain-proposed-tax-cut-for-m40-tax-rise-for-t20-FC10657417

    02/20/2023, 11:10

    64.71% Shortened!

    President Chow Chee Yen said the purpose of the tax reduction is to help the M40 with the rising cost of living and increase their disposable income, while the tax increase on the T20 is to alleviate the reduction in revenue collection caused by the tax cut

    “As such, I would expect the respective tax cut of two ppt and tax increase of 0.5 ppt to be maintained,” he told Bernama via email recently

    Under Budget 2023 tabled on Oct 7, 2022, by the former government, the income tax for the chargeable income band of between RM50,001 to RM100,000 was reduced by two ppt for the year of assessment 2023 -- from 13 per cent to 11 per cent for the RM50,001-RM70,000 band, and from 21 per cent to 19 per cent for the RM70,001-RM100,000 band

    Former prime minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob’s administration also raised the tax for those in the chargeable income bracket of between RM250,001 and RM400,000 from 24.5 per cent to 25 per cent

    Meanwhile, he said the return of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) would not be on the cards as Anwar has recently stated that the government would not introduce the broad-based consumption tax

    “GST is not the priority of the current government in this upcoming budget because, being a broad-based consumption tax, GST would also impact the low and middle-income households

    ['tax', 'budget', 'government', 'income', 'would']

    President Chow Chee Yen said the purpose of the tax reduction is to help the M40 with the rising cost of living and increase their disposable income, while the tax increase on the T20 is to alleviate the reduction in revenue collection caused by the tax cut

    “As such, I would expect the respective tax cut of two ppt and tax increase of 0.5 ppt to be maintained,” he told Bernama via email recently

    Under Budget 2023 tabled on Oct 7, 2022, by the former government, the income tax for the chargeable income band of between RM50,001 to RM100,000 was reduced by two ppt for the year of assessment 2023 -- from 13 per cent to 11 per cent for the RM50,001-RM70,000 band, and from 21 per cent to 19 per cent for the RM70,001-RM100,000 band

    Former prime minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob’s administration also raised the tax for those in the chargeable income bracket of between RM250,001 and RM400,000 from 24.5 per cent to 25 per cent

    Meanwhile, he said the return of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) would not be on the cards as Anwar has recently stated that the government would not introduce the broad-based consumption tax

    “GST is not the priority of the current government in this upcoming budget because, being a broad-based consumption tax, GST would also impact the low and middle-income households

    ['tax', 'budget', 'government', 'income', 'would']



  • AT LEAST 41,020 DEAD FROM POWERFUL TWIN EARTHQUAKES IN SOUTHERN TURKIYE

    https://www.thesundaily.my/world/at-least-41020-dead-from-powerful-twin-earthquakes-in-southern-turkiye-GC10657537

    02/20/2023, 11:10

    53.85% Shortened!

    According to Turkish Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency (AFAD), a total of 19,436 local and international search and rescue personnel are currently working in the field

    Search and rescue efforts have been completed in the earthquake zone except in Kahramanmaras and Hatay provinces, Yunus Sezer, the head of AFAD, told reporters

    Sezer said search and rescue efforts continued in nearly 40 buildings, while over 6,000 containers have been set up

    Noting that evacuations from the earthquake zone to other provinces are continuing, he said that over 460,900 people have so far been evacuated

    “We continue to house more than 1 million disaster victims in the region in tent cities, container cities and public guesthouses.” Sezer said that cash aid of 10,000 Turkish liras (US$531) has been given to nearly 800,000 citizens

    Speaking to reporters in Gaziantep province, Environment, Urbanisation and Climate Change Minister Murat Kurum said inspections at 927,000 buildings consisting of 3,520,000 independent sections in the earthquake zone had been completed

    ['earthquake', 'country', 'disaster', 'say', 'province']

    Search and rescue efforts have been completed in the earthquake zone except in Kahramanmaras and Hatay provinces, Yunus Sezer, the head of AFAD, told reporters

    Sezer said search and rescue efforts continued in nearly 40 buildings, while over 6,000 containers have been set up

    Noting that evacuations from the earthquake zone to other provinces are continuing, he said that over 460,900 people have so far been evacuated

    “We continue to house more than 1 million disaster victims in the region in tent cities, container cities and public guesthouses.” Sezer said that cash aid of 10,000 Turkish liras (US$531) has been given to nearly 800,000 citizens

    President Chow Chee Yen said the purpose of the tax reduction is to help the M40 with the rising cost of living and increase their disposable income, while the tax increase on the T20 is to alleviate the reduction in revenue collection caused by the tax cut

    "As such, I would expect the respective tax cut of two ppt and tax increase of 0.5 ppt to be maintained,” he told Bernama via email recently

    Under Budget 2023 tabled on Oct 7, 2022, by the former government, the income tax for the chargeable income band of between RM50,001 to RM100,000 was reduced by two ppt for the year of assessment 2023 -- from 13 per cent to 11 per cent for the RM50,001-RM70,000 band, and from 21 per cent to 19 per cent for the RM70,001-RM100,000 band

    Former prime minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob’s administration also raised the tax for those in the chargeable income bracket of between RM250,001 and RM400,000 from 24.5 per cent to 25 per cent

    Meanwhile, he said the return of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) would not be on the cards as Anwar has recently stated that the government would not introduce the broad-based consumption tax

    "GST is not the priority of the current government in this upcoming budget because, being a broad-based consumption tax, GST would also impact the low and middle-income households

  • SINGAPORE TO TAX LUXURY CARS UP TO 100% MORE – BMW 7 SERIES PRICE UP RM142K, ASTON DBX UP RM636K! - PAULTAN.ORG

    https://paultan.org/2023/02/20/singapore-to-tax-luxury-cars-up-to-100-more-bmw-7-series-price-up-rm142k-aston-dbx-up-rm636k/

    02/20/2023

    56.25% Shortened!

    Seems like my dream car is getting further away

    For EVs such as the Tesla Model 3 AWD Performance (OMV S$73,984, or RM245,277) is expected to see an ARF hike of almost S$16,000 (RM53,044)

    Moving up the luxury ladder, the Audi A8 (OMV S$79,392, or RM263,215) gets an ARF hike of almost S$20,000 (RM66,307), while the BMW 7 Series (OMV S$103,000, or RM341,485) gets an ARF hike of more than S$40,000 (RM132,615)

    Of course, the OMV is only part of the story of vehicle pricing, and for Singapore, the other significant component in a vehicle’s price tag is the COE or certificate of entitlement, which is a sum paid to the city-state’s land transport authority in order to register a car for road use, and is essentially a quota system to regulate the number of vehicle’s on the country’s roads

    In the top COE tier, Category E or the open category, the quota premium is currently S$105,002 (RM348,219)

    These adjustments come as part of the Singapore government’s wider efforts toward implementing a “progressive vehicle tax system” for the country’s car market, according to SG Car Mart

    max 1 car registered per person rich is still rich, no matter how much goment tax

    ['car', 'february', 'singapore', 'arf', 'vehicle']

    Of course, the OMV is only part of the story of vehicle pricing, and for Singapore, the other significant component in a vehicle’s price tag is the COE or certificate of entitlement, which is a sum paid to the city-state’s land transport authority in order to register a car for road use, and is essentially a quota system to regulate the number of vehicle’s on the country’s roads

    In the top COE tier, Category E or the open category, the quota premium is currently S$105,002 (RM348,219)

    These adjustments come as part of the Singapore government’s wider efforts toward implementing a “progressive vehicle tax system” for the country’s car market, according to SG Car Mart

    "It is the United States and not China that is endlessly shipping weapons to the battlefield," China's foreign ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin said on Monday, when asked about the US claims

    Later on Monday, the EU's foreign policy chief warned China against providing weapons to Russia for its war on Ukraine

    The United States has repeatedly warned China against providing support to Russia for its war in Ukraine, which is nearing its one-year anniversary

    In Munich, Blinken and Wang Yi clashed over Washington's shooting down of a Chinese balloon over its airspace

    He also warned Wang "about the implications and consequences if China provides material support to Russia or assistance with systemic sanctions evasion", Price said

    In turn, Wang Yi told Blinken that their countries' relations had been damaged by how Washington reacted to the balloon, which China has repeatedly described as a civilian craft for weather research that veered off course

    02/20/2023, 10:10

    50.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise BANGI, Feb 20 — A group of students that were caught on video vandalising school equipment has been called for counselling to understand the motives of their actions, Education Minister Fadhlina Sidek said today

    The minister also urged the public to stop spreading the video to protect the students’ identities and ensure an effective counselling process

    “We have finished the investigation process which involved their parents and implemented the intervention process

    She was referring to a group of local students who were shown in a viral video vandalising school equipment to celebrate the end of the school term

    “I cannot reveal [their identities] due to integrity, we need to protect the faces of the students and the school to make sure they can receive continuous counselling

    The minister also urges the public to not “give up” on this group of students and believes there are issues behind them that need to be addressed

    ['group', 'student', 'video', 'school', 'counsel']

  • ADVOCATES TELL PAS REP LINKING FOOD QUALITY TO AUTISM IRRESPONSIBLE, GIVES WRONG IMPRESSION

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/20/advocates-tell-pas-rep-linking-food-quality-to-autism-irresponsible-gives-wrong-impression/55787

    02/20/2023, 10:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 20 — The Autism Inclusiveness Direct Action Group (Aida) today condemned Kapar MP Dr Halimah Ali over her remarks linking poor nutrition to cause autism

    “Her statement gives a wrong impression to the public, further causing immense stigma and belief that autism is caused by poor care and determined by your level of income,” Aida said in a statement

    Aida also said that the group is ready to participate in meaningful dialogues to alleviate any stigma against the autism community

    “We strongly urge that policymakers and those in the authority of medical care and its allied practitioners, be mindful, and responsible with how they speak of autism,” said Aida

    Similarly, the Autistic peer support group, Autism Initiatives Malaysia also condemned Dr Halimah over her remarks

    “Having an MP who is a trained medical doctor stating ‘low-quality’ foods to be a cause for autism is appalling as there is no science behind it

    ['autism', 'group', 'aida', 'halimah', 'remark']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 20 — The Autism Inclusiveness Direct Action Group (Aida) today condemned Kapar MP Dr Halimah Ali over her remarks linking poor nutrition to cause autism

    “Her statement gives a wrong impression to the public, further causing immense stigma and belief that autism is caused by poor care and determined by your level of income,” Aida said in a statement

    Aida also said that the group is ready to participate in meaningful dialogues to alleviate any stigma against the autism community

    “We strongly urge that policymakers and those in the authority of medical care and its allied practitioners, be mindful, and responsible with how they speak of autism,” said Aida

    Similarly, the Autistic peer support group, Autism Initiatives Malaysia also condemned Dr Halimah over her remarks

    “Having an MP who is a trained medical doctor stating ‘low-quality’ foods to be a cause for autism is appalling as there is no science behind it

  • AUTISM GROUPS TELLS PAS REP LINKING FOOD QUALITY TO AUTISM IRRESPONSIBLE, GIVES WRONG IMPRESSION

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/20/autism-groups-tells-pas-rep-linking-food-quality-to-autism-irresponsible-gives-wrong-impression/55787

    02/20/2023, 10:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 20 — The Autism Inclusiveness Direct Action Group (Aida) today condemned Kapar MP Dr Halimah Ali over her remarks linking poor nutrition to cause autism

    “Her statement gives a wrong impression to the public, further causing immense stigma and belief that autism is caused by poor care and determined by your level of income,” Aida said in a statement

    Aida also said that the group is ready to participate in meaningful dialogues to alleviate any stigma against the autism community

    “We strongly urge that policymakers and those in the authority of medical care and its allied practitioners, be mindful, and responsible with how they speak of autism,” said Aida

    Similarly, the Autistic peer support group, Autism Initiatives Malaysia also condemned Dr Halimah over her remarks

    “Having an MP who is a trained medical doctor stating ‘low-quality’ foods to be a cause for autism is appalling as there is no science behind it

    ['autism', 'group', 'aida', 'halimah', 'remark']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 20 — The Autism Inclusiveness Direct Action Group (Aida) today condemned Kapar MP Dr Halimah Ali over her remarks linking poor nutrition to cause autism

    “Her statement gives a wrong impression to the public, further causing immense stigma and belief that autism is caused by poor care and determined by your level of income,” Aida said in a statement

    Aida also said that the group is ready to participate in meaningful dialogues to alleviate any stigma against the autism community

    “We strongly urge that policymakers and those in the authority of medical care and its allied practitioners, be mindful, and responsible with how they speak of autism,” said Aida

    Similarly, the Autistic peer support group, Autism Initiatives Malaysia also condemned Dr Halimah over her remarks

    “Having an MP who is a trained medical doctor stating ‘low-quality’ foods to be a cause for autism is appalling as there is no science behind it

    Yes, I’m very happy to have him back and playing at this level.” Liverpool will be aiming to continue their promising form over the next week
